JAISALMER: Worries of families of students stuck in Wuhan in China have increased with growing cases of coronavirus patients there. Three students from Barmer are caught in Wuhan. Of 56 Indians stuck in Wuhan, seven are from Rajasthan with three from Barmer alone.Apart from these MBBS students, many are caught in Kujhagan city in China who are not getting permission to come to India. These students are kept in hospital and are not allowed to go out. The family members are in touch with their children through video calling. A student Akash Sharda, in a video call, said that total 56 students front India are caught in Wuhan of which seven students are from Rajasthan. They are getting full facility from the University and embassy is also motivating them and soon they will be sent to India. Indian and Chinese government is working in this regard. These students are locked in a room as it is very dangerous to go out.He said they are in a group and are checked thrice a day.

Title: Samatha convicts cite poverty, seek mercy
Content:
Representative image

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

HYDERABAD: The Samatha case convicts — Shaik Babu , Shaik Shabuddin and Shaik Maqdoom — pleaded with principal sessions judge MG Priyadarshini to show mercy on them since they hail from poor financial background and that their children and ageing parents are dependent on them.Before delivering the verdict, the judge told the accused that their offence was proved and asked whether they would like to say something to the court. While declaring the three guilty, the judge asked for their reaction. They claimed they were innocent.The judge, however, dismissed their pleas twice since the crime perpetrated by the trio was heinous and qualified for rarest of the rare cases. Later, while pronouncing the verdict, the judge explained to the convicts on the quantum of the sentence awarded to them under each sections.“At this stage, they were asked to give their opinions. The convicts sought lenient punishment. All the three claimed they have four children each besides ageing parents. The judge, however, awarded capital punishment,’’ additional public prosecutor Ramana Reddy said.Prosecution said they provided circumstantial evidence by producing witnesses who saw the accused trailing the woman minutes before committing the offence, some persons who heard the woman’s screams for help and a shopowner who saw the trio buying a soft drink at his store with blood-stained clothes.The trio was arrested three days after they committed the offence on November 24. Cops recovered the blood-stained clothes and the knife used by them to slit the woman’s throat and also the stolen mobile phone. The trio also took away Rs 200 from her.The woman hawker and her husband used to move from one village to another in Kumaram Bheem-Asifabad district to sell balloons and utensils. When she was in Yellapatar village, the trio trailed her and forcefully took her into cotton fields where they raped her and later killed her.

Title: Ignore sports at your own peril: Gutta Jwala
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Gutta Jwala

GUNTUR: Veteran badminton player Gutta Jwala has asked students to keep in mind that only sportspersons can become world champions. She said that ignoring sports and games would cost them dearly in the future.

Jwala was addressing students at Vignan Mahotsav, a mega sports and cultural event at Vignan University near here on Thursday. The campus teemed with thousands of students who arrived here to take part in different sports, cultural and academic competitions.

Addressing the students, Jwala said sports and games would also keep young brains fit to take up global challenges. She asked students to concentrate on physical fitness along with studies. She asked students not to confine themselves to the four walls of the classrooms if they really wanted to become tomorrow’s champions.

Chief executive officer of ITC Agro Business Division , Sanjeev Rangrass said there was no substitute to hard work to realise goals. He asked the students to take failures as stepping stones for success and keep learning till they achieved better results. He said every student should introspect whether they deserve the success they have achieved and improve it further by hard work. Vignan Educational Institutions group chairman Dr Lavu Rathaiah said students should not miss physical fitness schedules for any reason. He said keeping fit was key to achieving success and that Vignan University had launched credits for physical fitness to keep students ahead of others. He said they have been organising Vignan Mahotsav for the 16 years to encourage youth to take extra-curricular activities seriously.

He said Vignan University believed that holistic development of students was possible only by allowing them to take part in sports and cultural activities. Participation in inter-university, inter-collegiate competitions will help students become true leaders as they would learn many things, he said.

Title: Rs 14L worth gold recovered from flier’s rectum
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Hyderabad: An air passenger who hid gold paste in his rectum was nabbed by customs officials at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGIA) on Wednesday. The value of gold was pegged at Rs 14.71 lakh. Customs officials intercepted an air passenger, who flew in from Mumbai. And, when he was verified, they found gold paste hidden in his rectum.

During investigation, the officials came to know that the passenger boarded the transit flight at Mumbai after it came from Dubai. During the Mumbai-Hyderabad leg of the international flight, the accused collected the gold from an international passenger, they said.

In another case, customs officials seized Rs 50 lakh worth foreign cigarettes after nabbing 10 international passengers. Nine passengers had arrived from Kuala Lumpur, while another came from Sharjah.

Title: Family hails verdict,says justice prevailed
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Hyderabad: Soon after the verdict was pronounced, family members of Samatha expressed joy and happiness. At one point of time, her husband broke down in the court complex.

“I cannot bring back my wife to my children but I will be their father and mother. I thank district police and government for taking steps to punish the culprits by awarding them capital punishment,’’ he told mediapersons. After the verdict, he even fell at the feet of the investigators.

Earlier, he along with members of his village, relatives and community heads reached the Adilabad court complex in the morning. They prayed for capital punishment for the three accused. Samatha’s rape and murder rocked the district and widespread protests were taken out demanding justice on the lines of police encounter in which four accused of raping and murdering Disha was killed.

“Thursday’s verdict has proved that justice is possible to everyone irrespective of caste or creed. Through this judgment, we got confidence that police, court and government are here to take care of victims to make sure that the guilty persons are punished and not allowed to go scot-free,’’ a relative of the woman’s family told mediapersons.

Gosampalli village in Khanapur mandal where the woman’s family lives hailed the verdict. A large number of relatives of the woman and members of Dalit organisations were present at the court.

Earlier, the three accused were presented before the court in the morning.

Heavy security was deployed at the court to prevent any untoward incident.

Title: DA case: Top SEZ official charged
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Ahmedabad: The Central Bureau of Investigation has filed a chargesheet in the court of special judge, Mumbai, against the then development commissioner, special economic zone, Surat and Mangalore, Vijay Shewale (now retired as additional DGFT) and others including his family members under relevant sections of the Prevention of Corruption Act and IPC in a disproportionate assets case.

CBI had registered a case against the then development commissioner, an Indian Telecom Service ( ITS officer) Vijay Shewale, of special economic zone, Surat and Mangalore alleging he had acquired huge assets in his own name, as well as in the names of his family members, during the period from January 1, 1999, to July 7, 2016.

During investigation, huge recovery of cash of around Rs 2 crore was made. The agency found 42 immovable properties owned by Shewalie at Mumbai, Malegaon, Nasik acquired through purchase; gifts from in-laws, and 25 bank accounts of him and his family members.

It was also alleged that huge cash was frequently deposited in most of these accounts. Disproportionate assets worth Rs 14.50 crore was found in his possession as on July 14, 2016 when the case was initiated.

Title: Bharat bandh: Manuu students boycott classes
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Shopkeepers hang posters outside their shops condemning CAA

HYDERABAD: Students of Maulana Azad National Urdu University (Manuu) boycotted classes on Wednesday in solidarity with Bharat Bandh call given by Bahujan Kranti Morcha.

Hundreds of students assembled near the education department and marched outside the main gate against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR). Students also raised slogans and held posters reading ‘withdraw CAA ’.

Members of the Manuu Coordination Committee against CAA, NRC and NPR went to New Delhi to participate in the march to Jantar Mantar. The Manuu students ’ union president Umar Faruq and vice-president Intekhab Alam addressed the protest gathering at Jantar Mantar.

Many shops in Old City area were shut in support of Bharat Bandh call. Roads across Nampally, leading up to Old City areas, including the famous Lad Bazaar near Charminar, wore a deserted look as many outlets remained closed.

Many shopkeepers had pasted posters outside their shops condemning the new Act. The posters read — ‘with an Indian passport you can prove yourself Indian in all other countries of the world, except your own country’. The shutdown call had no impact in the rest of the city. The BKM members staged a protest at Ambedkar statue.

Meanwhile, the voluntary group of Citizens Against CAA-NRC-NPR has planned to organise a human chain at Dharna Chowk on Thursday.

Title: A year on, IAV yet to be made functional
Content: Thiruvananthapuram: The Institute of Advanced Virology (IAV), phase I of which was inaugurated last year, will be functional only by March.Proposed to carry out high-end research on virus and viral infections, IAV was highlighted as a solution to end the state’s dependence on laboratories in other states. However, a year after its inauguration, the state still had to depend on national institute of virology, Pune, to examine presence of novel coronavirus in the samples sent from Kerala K P Sudheer, executive vice-president of Kerala state council for science, technology and environment, under which IAV would function, said they have taken measures to appoint experts from foreign countries. “The appointment process took time as there were not enough experts in our country. We have zeroed in on an Indian scientist, who is currently working in a foreign institution. Purchase order to import equipment is also progressing well. We are expecting to make it functional by March. So far, there is no procedural delay,” he said.Meanwhile, the state government has sanctioned the post of director, senior scientist and administration staff for IAV. The KSCSTE will soon submit a proposal for appointment of more scientists.The phase I of the campus was inaugurated by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan at Thonnakkal in February last year. IAV was proposed as a centre of excellence to work in collaboration with international institutions for training and education for prevention and control of viral infections. It is proposed to have departments of clinical virology, viral diagnostics, viral vaccines, antiviral drug research, virus applications, Virus epidemiology, vector dynamics and public health, virus genomics, bioinformatics and statistics and general virology.

Title: Cops recover stolen Quran gifted to Bhilwara family by Akbar, 1 held
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: City police recovered an antique, lettered Quran which was said to be gifted by Akbar to a family in Bhilwara and was reported stolen on September 12, 2019. An accused was also arrested when he tried to sell the antique book to a buyer in Badi Chaupar in Jaipur on Wednesday.

The accused was identified as 29-year-old Banwari Meena who belongs to Jamwaramgarh in Jaipur.

Hariom Singh, ASI, Manak Chowk police station who was part of the team that apprehended the accused told TOI, “The accused along with his gang found about the ancient Quran which was given to a family associated with Mandalgarh Fort. The family was going through a financial crunch and since the Quran was part of their private collection, they decided to sell it. The word reached the gang who got in touch with the complainant and pretended to be interested buyers.”

The Quran contains 1,014 pages which are all worded in golden letters.

Following this, few of the gang members reached Bhilwara where they asked the complainant to meet them at a secluded location along with the book. They beat him and stole the book from him. The accused then set up a deal with a Bangladeshi buyer for Rs 16 crore in exchange for the Quran but that also fell through.

Previously, cops had arrested a couple of Meena’s accomplices as well. He himself was wanted in a case where he had stolen over Rs 4 lakh from a person under the pretext of getting him gold at a lower rate in Chandwaji area.

Title: SP MLA’s bro gave contract to murder cousin, say killers
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Varanasi: Ghazipur police, on Thursday arrested three persons for killing Lalbabu Pasi, the cousin of Samajwadi Party MLA from Saidpur Subhas Pasi, on January 25 night.

Lalbabu was found murdered in Bhudkuda area on January 26. The arrested accused claimed that the MLA’s brother Moti Pasi gave them contract to kill Lalbabu. The MLA is also the complainant in this case. SP Ghazipur OP Singh said that police were investigating the claim of the accused.

The arrested accused were identified as Shailendra Yadav of Karanda, Arvind Yadav and Sadan Gond of Saidpur area.

During initial investigations, they divulged that MLA’s brother Moti had given them the contract to kill Lalbabu over some monetary dispute.

SP said two more persons have come on the radar of police following this revelation.

Accused Shailendra admitted that he had called Lalbabu to meet him on January 25 evening and later hacked him to death with the help of his accomplices.

Title: Industry-institution seminar conducted at Hindu College
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Guntur: Courage to face ordeals, commitment to work ethics and productivity will make management students future global leaders, industrialist Tulasi Ramachandra Prabhu said on Thursday. He said students should not deviate from set goals till they realise their dreams. Prabhu inaugurated the two-day industry-institution interactive session at Hindu College of Management here.

Addressing students, Prabhu said management trainees should be ready to face challenges and tune themselves to the needs of the industry. He asked students to closely follow developments across the globe and take a leaf out of the book of industrialists. He said students should keep in mind that no one can succeed as an industrialist without industry and the desire to excel. Dean of management school at Acharya Nagarjuna University (ANU) Dr Ramineni Sivaramprasad asked the students to think out of the box to succeed in their career. University of Bangalore professor Muni Narayanappa asked students to be ready to take up the challenges that economic slowdown may bring about. tnn

Title: Jaipur airport slips to 89th spot in 4th quarter: Survey
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The Jaipur airport slips to 89th position in the Airport Service Quality (ASQ) survey done by Airport Council International (ACI) for fourth quarter (October 2019 to December 2019). In the third quarter, Jaipur airport was at 63th position.

The constant increase of passengers, construction works have led to the degradation in the facilities which resulted in the slide of ranking.

In 2017, Jaipur airport ranked number 1 in the ASQ survey but with the constant increase in passengers and increase in frequency of the flights the service has badly affected in past three years.

TOI got the copy of the survey released on Thursday evening.

“The survey is done once in every three months to check the quality of services given to the passengers at the airports across the country. The results are really shocking for us,” said a senior officer of airport authority of India, Jaipur on the condition of anonymity.

Jaipur Airport was voted the number 1 airport in the world in the 2017 survey in the 2.5 million passengers per year. “Till December 2019, Jaipur airport had handled nearly 4.75 lakh passengers,” said an officer.

Ranchi airport has been on the top among 24 airports across the country, while Lucknow at number two and Trivandrum Airport at number three. “Some of the airports that are ahead of Jaipur are Ranchi (1), Lucknow (2), Trivandrum (3), Ahmedabad (4), Calicut(5), Indore (6), Varanasi (7) and others,” said an officer.

Airport Authority of India (AAI), Jaipur director Jaideep Singh Balhara said, “In past three months, we have undertaken many construction works to facilitate the passengers which could be the reason why in the fourth quarter our results are not satisfactory. However, with the new facilities, including new arrival and departure gates, we will certainly come up in the survey for 2020 and its quarters.”

This survey of airport service quality was conducted on 33 standards related to passengers.

In the survey, feedback is taken at every point from the time passengers enter the airport to the inside of the plane. At the same time, information is taken on all points till the time of arrival by airplane, collecting baggage, catching taxi and departure.

During the survey, eight standards were found at Jaipur airport, were bad. Passengers have completely rejected the facilities of Jaipur airport administration on these standards.

Title: Gujarat HC stays action against Morbi ceramics units facing huge fines
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Thursday stayed the Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB) from taking any action against 480 ceramics units in the Morbi-Wankaner cluster, who were ordered to pay a fine of Rs 5,000 for every day since their establishment for causing environmental damage.

The GPCB issued notices to 600 ceramic units for continuing to use coal gasifiers despite a strict ‘no’ from the National Green Tribunal and the Gujarat high court in March and November 2019, respectively. The GPCB cited a report by a committee set up by the NGT, which held ceramics units responsible for violation of pollution rules and recommended a penalty of Rs 5,000 for every day since the day GPCB gave its consent for the establishment of that particular unit.

GPCB had issued notices in September, to which the ceramics units filed replies. However, the board issued final notices in the last two months to some 600 units, holding them at default with judicial orders to do away with gasifiers. The notice was for a fine for interim environmental damages, computed at Rs 5,000 per day, or Rs 18.25 lakh per year. Most ceramics units have been functioning for more than five years. They were given 15 days to deposit the fines, which run into more than Rs 500 crore.

GPCB said that in case of failure to pay the fines, it would decide on further more stringent action without providing a hearing opportunity to the ceramics units, for breaching various provisions of the Water Act and the Air Act, which include punishment with imprisonment for a term not less than one year and six months and which could extend to six years, besides fines.

On Thursday, 480 units approached the high court through advocate Pritesh Khambholja and challenged the notices demanding the massive fines. It was submitted that GPCB did not grant them a hearing against the final notice, which is against the principle of natural justice.

After a preliminary hearing, the bench of Justice Harsha Devani and Justice Sangeeta Vishen issued notices to GPCB, the state government and the Centre, and directed the authorities “not to take any coercive steps pursuant to the impugned legal notices/orders”.

Title: Top bureaucrats of Telangana & Andhra Pradesh meet, discuss bifurcation issues
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Telangana chief secretary Somesh Kumar and his AP counterpart Neelam Sawhney greet each other in the city on T... Read More

HYDERABAD: Telangana and Andhra Pradesh have decided to mutually resolve pending issues pertaining to Schedule IX and X institutions listed in the AP Reorganisation Act , 2014 soon.

The two states are at loggerheads over distribution of assets and liabilities of the 91 institutions under Schedule IX for the past six years.

Telangana chief secretary Somesh Kumar and his AP counterpart Neelam Sawhney met on Thursday on the pending bifurcation issues between the two states. AP claimed that it has no disputes over bifurcation of 53 institutions, while Telangana reportedly said it has no problem over 68 institutions. Both the states have reservations over distribution of assets and liabilities of RTC, power utilities and some organisations.

The chief secretaries also discussed about the bifurcation of power utilities employees, which even went up to the Supreme Court. However, no decision was taken on the issue.

Telangana chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and his Andhra counterpart YS Jaganmohan Reddy , who had met earlier this month, directed their officers to hold a joint meeting on resolving pending issues. Officials said the meeting was held in a very positive manner and decided to continue the dialogue further and brief their respective CMs on the issues.

Title: IRDAI panel moots flexi premium payment to boost microinsurance
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Hyderabad: In a bid to ensure deeper penetration of microinsurance in the country, the committee on microinsurance, which has submitted its report to the insurance regulator IRDAI, has rooted for offering customers more flexibility in paying premium, be it on a daily, fortnightly or even monthly and quarterly basis.

“There should be an option to pay single premium in daily / fortnightly / monthly / quarterly instalments. Customers should be allowed to pay mortality premium in lump sum with remaining premiums to be allowed to be paid in instalment,” the committee has recommended.

The committee highlighted the importance of keeping the policy simple and comprehensible for customers as that would give them confidence to opt for it. “Product benefits should be simple so that they could be easily conveyed by the distributor and understood by the customer,” it said. Besides, it added that a simple one-page proposal form and digital policy document should be applicable for all insurers.

The committee was of the view that the pricing of microinsurance products can be reduced by several ways, such as reduction in reserve requirement even for a short duration can help in better pricing. It also said that there is a requirement of waiver of stamp duty on microinsurance products.

On the distribution front, it said that cooperatives or self-help groups can be made partners in providing insurance solutions as it will improve penetration of microinsurance products. The panel said the microinsurance (MI) agent should have flexibility to distribute products of more than one insurance company like a corporate agency and more entities should be included under the definition of MI agents. The function of policy issuance using customized IT applications should be outsourced to MI intermediaries who have the necessary human and physical infrastructure, it said.

It further said that the claim pay-out can be linked to the goal of the target segment. For example, if they are saving for the child, the claim pay-out should be linked to the school fee of their kids.

Microinsurance is specifically targeted at low-income populations, with affordable insurance products to help them cope with and recover from financial losses. In India, around 29.5% of the total population (36 crore) lives below the poverty line, of which 10.2 crore people live in urban areas while 25.8 crore live in rural areas.

Title: OU professor detention: Police unable to decrypt devices
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Ch Kaseem

HYDERABAD: The Telangana police have informed the high court that Maoists were using pretty good privacy (PGP) encryption to store their data and even forensic experts were finding it difficult to crack it. Police stated this in their affidavit filed in Osmania University associate professor Ch Kaseem ’s detention case.

“We seize several hard disks and electronic devices during our search operations at places belonging to Maoists, but since they are using the PGP encryption, we are finding it difficult to decode the material retrieved from these devices,” assistant commissioner of police, Gajwel, P Narayana said in the affidavit filed before the court. He also explained the cases and details of FIRs against Kaseem. He (Kaseem) was asking people to revolt against the state, the affidavit added.

The ACP filed the counter on the direction of a bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy, which was hearing a plea that challenged the detention of Kaseem. As police were linking Kaseem with Maoists, the CJ sought evidence.

Narayana, in his counter, narrated about how the Maoists believe in Mao Tse Tsung and his philosophy that “political power flows through the barrel of the gun". They have three magic weapons the party, the people's army and the united front, the ACP explained. They have mass organisations to prepare people for the final revolution, he added.

“Constitutional governance in Telangana was brought to a standstill for nearly three decades by Maoists,” he said.

“They posed the highest threat to the sinternal security and the state faced a lot of problems in fighting the Maoists’ unconventional guerilla warfare. They committed 12,612 incidents in Telangana and killed 2,182 civilians, 370 public representatives, including a state minister, a former speaker, and two legislators, 404 police personnel, including 3 IPS officers,” the ACP said.

Title: Top bureaucrats of Telangana & Andhra Pradesh meet, discuss bifurcation issues
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Telangana chief secretary Somesh Kumar and his AP counterpart Neelam Sawhney greet each other in the city on T... Read More

HYDERABAD: Telangana and Andhra Pradesh have decided to mutually resolve pending issues pertaining to Schedule IX and X institutions listed in the AP Reorganisation Act , 2014 soon.

The two states are at loggerheads over distribution of assets and liabilities of the 91 institutions under Schedule IX for the past six years.

Telangana chief secretary Somesh Kumar and his AP counterpart Neelam Sawhney met on Thursday on the pending bifurcation issues between the two states. AP claimed that it has no disputes over bifurcation of 53 institutions, while Telangana reportedly said it has no problem over 68 institutions. Both the states have reservations over distribution of assets and liabilities of RTC, power utilities and some organisations.

The chief secretaries also discussed about the bifurcation of power utilities employees, which even went up to the Supreme Court. However, no decision was taken on the issue.

Telangana chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and his Andhra counterpart YS Jaganmohan Reddy , who had met earlier this month, directed their officers to hold a joint meeting on resolving pending issues. Officials said the meeting was held in a very positive manner and decided to continue the dialogue further and brief their respective CMs on the issues.

Title: Illegal liquor worth Rs 50 lakh seized; gang busted, one held
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Allahabad: Special Task Force (Allahabad unit) on Thursday claimed to have busted an interstate racket involved in smuggling liquor and arrested its key operative near Lalgpalganj while he was waiting to deliver the consignment.

The arrested man was identified as Jaswant Singh, resident of Indore in Madhya Pradesh.

As many as 974 cartons of illegal liquor (46,792 bottles) worth Rs 50 lakh , a truck, one mobile phone, a driving license and Rs 586 cash were seized.

“The liquor bottles did not have holograms on them,” said police.

Additional SP (STF) Neeraj Kumar Pandey told TOI that the illegal liquor consignment was brought from Madhya Pradesh and was to be delivered in eastern UP districts.

“A joint team of STF and Nawabaganj police, on a tip-off about the delivery of illegal liquor near Nindura railway crossing, cordoned the area and seized the truck carrying the consignment,” added Pandey.

“Jaswant revealed that a man from Kheri village in Indore Kheri, Sudhakar Tripathi, had asked him to deliver the consignment near Lalgopalganj where other members of the racket would reach and drive the truck to another destination,” Pandey said.

“A case under section 60\72 of Excise Act has been registered in the same regard,” said police.

Title: Rajasthan: Sarpanch shuns chair in Sirohi district, places photo of Nakoda Bhairav on it
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

The picture of Nakoda Bhairav on the chair of sarpanch in Sirohi

JAIPUR: Rejecting the superstitious tag attached to him, Ajabaram Chaudhary, who became sarpanch from Reodar gram panchayat in Sirohi district , placed the photo of Nakoda Bhairav , the God he worships, on the chair of the sarpanch and has vowed to work for the people sitting on the ground, which he believes would put him on an equal footing with the people of the village.

Chaudhary believes that "greed for power and the urge to cling to one's chair" would make a person egoistic and, therefore, he would avoid sitting on the chair. Chaudhary, who was elected sarpanch in the second phase of panchayat polls held on January 22, took charge on January 25.

"When I was campainging in the villages, I had vowed not to sit on the sarpanch's chair after getting elected. Therefore, I decided to sit on the ground for the next five years and work for the people of the village. This would put me on an equal footing with the people of village," Chaudhary told TOI.

"Moreover, I am a believer and devotee of Nakoda Bhairavji. That's why I have placed the photo of God on Sapanch's chair and would remain seated there for 5 years. I want to avoid sitting on the chair as it makes a person egoistic and he/she hardly focuses on developmental works," he added.

Title: States can express opinion, can’t oppose NPR: Nalsar vice-chancellor
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

HYDERABAD: Vice-chancellor of National Academy of Legal Studies and Research ( Nalsar ), Hyderabad, Faizan Mustafa tells Sribala Vadlapatla that citizenship is not just about borders, it is about membership to a political community adhering to the same values. CAA , NPR and NRC are opposed because they are in violation of the constitutional spirit. As these subjects are enshrined in central list of legislation, states can only say that their legislative powers are being limited.

Can the states who are opposing the NPR stop its implementation?

No way, because subjects like NPR and citizenship are in the central list of the enacting legislation. States may express their political opinion, at the same time they are implementing agencies for NPR and Census. As per the legislation, if states refuse to implement it, or if there is any disturbance, the Centre can impose presidential rule. Centre cannot do this through an app, it must depend on states. This again is a political decision. Even on the subjects which are in the concurrent list, when state and Centre legislate on the same subject, the central legislation prevails over state legislation.

There is debate that NPR and NRC are the same, what is your take on this?

If Census and NPR are the same, as some politicians have claimed, then why did the central government make huge allocations separately for both Census and NPR? The Vajpayee government made some changes through rules in the Citizenship Act. Frequent amendments are confusing the people. When the first NPR was done during the Congress regime, there was no problem in the question format. The eight additional documents said to be added in the present NPR are a cause of concern. Yes, NPR is very much a subset of NRC. The list prepared in NPR will be noted in NRC. Anyone who is listed to be suspicious, will not make it to the NRC.

The Centre has said that there is no need to show documents for NPR.

They may not ask for the documents but asking for Aadhaar number or PAN number is the same as asking for documents. The Supreme Court has said don’t link Aadhaar with any scheme, but in reality, what is happening is that the government uses Aadhaar for everything. The same will be the case with NPR or at least that is the apprehension of many. The fear is that such documents or information needed may not be available, which ultimately will lead to loss of citizenship. The arbitrary power of lower rank officials who will visit our houses to decide on our citizenship should be questioned.

Has any other country conducted an NRC-like exercise?

No, no country has conducted a similar exercise with such a large population. Most states give national identity cards. Take NRC in Assam. It was the Hindu population that was impacted. Those who submitted documents and became part of NRC, have not been given any identity cards so far. So, what is its purpose?

Do you think CAA is a constitutionally valid law and can the state approach courts against it?

Citizenship is not a concept confined to borders or geographical area. It is basically membership to a political community. States can challenge it (CAA), but the Supreme Court goes by the narrowed down technical grounds to give judgement and it will be passed. What the Kerala chief minister said was his political intention, but the central Act will prevail. States can only object. In such cases, their legislative powers will be questioned. But this is an unprecedented scenario. CAA is being opposed by many because it is violative of basic principles of the Constitution. In fact, there was discussion in the constituent assembly at that time whether all Hindus across the world who are stateless, should be given Indian citizenship, but the idea was rejected. Today, minorities living in the countries in India’s neighbourhood are not stateless. Then why are we conferring citizenship on them is also one argument.

What are other major objections to CAA ?

There is no consensus on this Act itself is the proof that it is violation of constitutional spirit. The minorities from Bangladesh, Pakistan and Afghan are allowed. There are hardly minorities in Afghanistan. In that case, Sri Lanka should have been part of CAA as there are many Tamil Hindus who want to settle in India. Despite Pakistan and Bangladesh being Muslim countries, religion is not a criteria for getting citizenship there. Afghanistan is much more advanced than us in framing citizenship rules in 1922. I guess here the chronology of intended actions was not right. They should have done NPR, NRC and then CAA.

Title: 82% polling in third phase of local polls
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

In the third phase of panchayat elections, 81.83% polling was recorded across 1,700 gram panchayats under 49 panchayat samitis with Hanumangarh registering the highest polling at 91.31%. In Jaipur, polling was 82.25%, with 82.52% in Viratnagar panchayat samiti, 82.64% in Jhotwara and 81.71% in Paota.

Title: No photo electoral system in ensuing Cantt board elections
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Secunderabad: The photo electoral rolls system will not be implemented in the ensuing Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB) elections owing to the expense and time that the system demands. The announcement was made by the president of the Secunderabad Cantonment Board, Brigadier Abhijit Chandra, in response to a letter from S Ravindra Babu, a resident of Ward 5.

Brigadier Chandra also said that financially the Secunderabad Cantonment Board was not in a good position and was barely able to provide residents with basic civic amenities.

Speaking to TOI, S Ravindra Babu said, “While the photo electoral rolls are being implemented by the Election Commisison for both State Assembly and Lok Sabha elections, why can’t the Ministry of Defence (MoD) impelement it for Cantonment Board elections?”

Adding that duplicate votes could be weeded out using photo electoral rolls, Babu said: “Section 31 of the Cantonment Act 2006, clearly states Cantonment Board chief executive officers have the authority to frame rules and regulations in order to conduct fair and corruption-free elections. But authorities are ignoring these rules.

Soon after MoD issued orders providing reservation for women in civilian wards, major political parties demanded that party leaders also be represented in wards and photo electoral rolls system be implemented in the upcoming polls.

Title: Indore to become one of first 10 beggar-free cities of India
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Beggars may soon vanish from Indore streets

INDORE: Beggars may soon vanish from Indore streets. If all goes well, Indore is set to become one of the first 10 beggar-free cities of India. The city has been selected by Centre as one of top-10 big cities to prepare and implement national-level action plan to end beggary.

The campaign, expected to be launched by April, will cover identification, rehabilitation , provision of medical facilities, counselling, education, skill development and sustainable settlement of people engaged in begging. The Union government has sought participation of other stakeholders including state government, local bodies and NGOs.

In response, state social justice department has appointed Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) as ‘nodal agency’ to establish coordination with departments concerned including woman and child development department (WCD), police and Childline for comprehensive rehabilitation of people currently engaged in begging and to ensure that every person has right to live a life of dignity.

In current scenario, WCD has responsibility to provide children accommodation in three orphanages of city, who are found engaged in begging, but has no separate shelter home for them. While, social justice department runs state’s only shelter home for beggars above 60 years of age, the same is in dilapidated condition and has given admission only to a few beggars in said category in last couple of years.

Besides, there is no shelter home to accommodate men, women beyond these categories and district administration also lacks schemes, projects to rehabilitate them.

On receiving Centre’s plan and instructions from state government, district administration has planned a meeting of members of rescue teams to take their suggestions in making action plan while another meeting will be held on February 7 of associations of industries and other departments concerned to help making a rehabilitation plan for beggars.

The district administration had formed two separate teams in coordination with WCD, Integrated Child Protection Scheme (ICPS), social workers, Childline, Special Juvenile Police Unite (SJPU), labour department and police of respected areas to launch a campaign to rescue beggars.

In last four months, joint teams have rescued around 100 children engaged in begging and labour.

In Union government’s said project, it will bear 60 per cent funding while remaining 40 per cent share is expected from state government.

Title: Gujarat: 2-day strike, PSU banks to reopen on Monday
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Bank employees are protesting non-revision of their wages

AHMEDABAD: Financial transactions, cheque clearances, issuing of drafts and letters of credit among other transactions might take a hit over the next three days, as branches of some 27 public sector banks in addition to a few private sector banks in the state will remain closed on a two-day strike , and Sunday falls on the third day.

Members of Maha Gujarat Bank Employees Association (MGBEA) are expected to join the nationwide strike on Friday and Saturday. With Sunday being a bank holiday, public sector banks will reopen on Monday.

“Bank employees are protesting non-revision of their wages, which has been pending since November 2017. That apart, we have also sought to reinitiate recruitments in the banking sector. Moreover, since alternate means of banking are now available, we have sought a five-day work week for all banks,” said Janak Rawal, general secretary, MGBEA.

An estimated 6,000 bank branches across Gujarat are expected to remain shut. As a result, bank transactions worth at least Rs 25,000 crore are likely to be impacted over the next two days across Gujarat, suggest estimates by bankers.

Trade and industry bodies have been extremely critical of the bank strike , as the processing of crucial payments, including salaries, could be stalled due to the strike call. A public interest litigation has also been filed in the Gujarat high court earlier this week by Gujarat Trader Federation (GTF) and seven other trade and industry bodies across Gujarat stating how bank strikes are hurting business activity.

“Frequent strikes by bank employees is hurting business activities. When banks are shut during the month end, issuing business payments and salaries becomes difficult," said Jayendra Tanna, president, GTF.

Title: Magh Mela: 30 lakh take holy dip in Sangam
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

The administration had expected the figures to touch 70 lakhs

ALLAHABAD: Around 30 lakh devotees, half of the number expected by the administration, took holy dip in Sangam on Fourth major bath of the ongoing Magh Mela on the occasion of Basant Panchami on Thursday.

The administration had expected the figures to touch 70 lakhs on the day.

Though there was a fall in the mercury, in comparison to Wednesday, it failed to deter the devotees. As per the met department, maximum temperature of Allahabad was recorded at 20.2 degree Celsius while minimum temperature was 13.4 degree, five degrees less on Wednesday. The maximum temperature on Wednesday was 25.2 degree celcius.

Devotees, braving cold, started thronging Magh Mela venue since early morning hours on Thursday. All the six temporary ghats witnessed the arrival of devotees since early morning as the muhurat of the auspicious snan was only for around five hours, from 7:53am to 12:23 noon.

“This was the fourth main snan day of the ongoing Magh Mela wherein around 30 lakhs devotees took holy dip,” said Mela Adhikari Rajnish Kumar Mishra. Elaborate arrangements

Elaborate arrangements were made by the administration.

Around 3,500 cops, including four companies of para military forces maintained strict vigil from watch towers on the day. Traffic restrictions were also in place on various routes of Allahabad. Vehicles’ entry on the mela campus was restricted on the day. Mounter police too kept a close vigil around the ghats.

The health departmnet officials too were vigilant. “Our ambulances were deployed at every corner of the mela area and were positioned in the vicinity of the ghats to meet any eventuality. The day passed off peacefully,” said the chief medical officer, G S Bajpayee.

Title: Govt order on appointment of 4k officials in villages
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Jaipur: The panchayati raj department on Thursday issued a notification to appoint over 4,000 administrators in all those gram panchayats whose term has already ended and the elections are yet to be held, and the panchayat samitis and zila parishads, whose term is going to end on February 7.

Over 4,000 administrators will be appointed, said a panchayati raj department source. According to the notification, gram sevaks and ex-officio secretaries would be appointed as administrators in the gram panchayats from the day its term ends. On the other hand, village development officers will be appointed as administrators in the panchayat samitis and chief executive officers will be appointed as administrators in the zila parishads from the day their term ends.

The administrators would remain in office tilll 'a day before the date of first meeting of the gram panchayat/panchayat samitis/zila parishads', the notification added. Earlier, SC upheld notifications of delimitation issued by the state government on November 15-16, December 1 and 12. It directed the State Election Commission to complete panchayat polls by second half of April.

Title: Woman employee manhandled, SCB staff threaten stir
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Secunderabad: A day after a property owner allegedly manhandled a woman surveyor from the Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB), the employees union on Thursday threatened agitations if such attacks go unpunished. Speaking to mediapersons, SCB Employees Union president Mahender and secretary Parushuram said the union is taking this incident seriously and has decided to stage agitations if such incidents recur. “The property owner has approached senior SCB officials and accused the woman surveyor of not doing her job properly,” Parushuram added. tnn

Title: Bank strikes not in public interest, says HC
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Ahmedabad: The Gujarat high court on Thursday remarked that strikes by employees of public sector banks are not in the greater public interest and the striking employees are liable to face punitive action.

Along with this remark, the bench headed by Chief Justice Vikram Nath asked the Centre and the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to reply to court’s question as to what action can be taken against striking bank employees. The court verbally observed that banking is an essential sector and a strike by employees would put the people at large at inconvenience. Their individual problems can be resolved through negotiations with the managements and the employees should not resort to action which is against the government’s policy.

The HC made observations and sought replies from the authorities by February 5 in response to a PIL filed by various trade federations through advocate Rashmin Jani. The PIL demanded a declaration that a strike by public sector bank employees is illegal and against the public interest because it stalls economic activity across the country.

The HC ordered the petitioners to serve the relevant documents to the lawyers representing the Centre and the RBI.

Citing the call for a strike on December 31 given by bank employees, the traders claimed that such repeated strike calls by bank employees causes severe problems for trade and industry in carrying out financial transactions. The petitioners highlighted that bank employees have also given a call for a three-day strike in March, and have threatened an indefinite strike from April 1 onwards, if their demands for wage revision and recruitment are not accepted.

Title: Jaipur: Minor ‘rape survivor’ delivers baby
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

Title: Rail official apologises for ‘Portuguese’ slur to Alina
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Panaji: General manager of South Western Railway (SWR), A K Singh, apologised to Cortalim MLA Alina Saldanha on Thursday for his ‘you Portuguese’ remark in reference to Goans. Saldanha said that it has been already stated that Singh will be transferred.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday summoned SWR officials to his Altinho residence to discuss the issue. Saldanha said that when the chief minister learnt about the incident he called her and the railway officials to a discussion.

“We will not accept such an insult, whether it is an MLA or a Goan. This is a serious matter and I have spoken to Union railway minister Piyush Goel and the official will apologise to Saldanha,” Sawant said.

Saldanha said that Sawant pointed out that a person who cannot control his emotions and does not have manners should not be allowed to work in the state.

It was during a meeting on resolving the issue of double tracking the railway line in South Goa earlier this month that the officer had made the remark. Alina had said that Singh with his derogatory remarks had “insulted all the people present there at the time in particular, and all the people of Goa in general.”

Incidentally, the officer was summoned to tender an apology in the presence of the media on Thursday a day after Cortalim MLA wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressing her displeasure over the controversial remark made by Singh, referring to her as of Portuguese descent.

Former South Goa MP Narendra Sawaikar was one of the first to condemn the Singh remark against Alina and others. The CM, however, had come under criticism for his “silence” over the slur.

Title: Commodore Ajay Patney takes charge
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Ahmedabad: Commodore Ajay Patney assumed the duties of commanding officer of INS Valsura, the premier electrical training establishment of Indian Navy from Commodore C Raghuram at an impressive ceremonial parade on Wednesday at Jamnagar.

Commodore Raghuram commanded INS Valsura from May 31, 2018 to till date contributing immensely to the training and administration of this premier naval establishment in Saurashtra region.

Commodore Patney was commissioned into the Indian Navy on November 30, 1991 and was awarded the President’s Gold Medal for standing first in his naval engineering course.tnn

Title: Para jumping show by top serving, retired army officers a huge draw
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

The para jumping and ring of fire shows were crowd-pullers. Brigadier S R Mazagaonkar (Retd)

PUNE: Deputy chief of army staff (planning and systems) Lt Gen Sudarshan Hasabnis, along with other serving and retired army officers, including two septuagenarians, participated in an exhilarating para jumping and sky diving exercise at Dighi Hills on Thursday as part of the bicentenary year celebration of the Bombay Engineering Group (BEG) and Centre, also known as the Bombay Sappers.

The event paid tribute to the soldiers who have died in wars and army operations.

“Only the Bombay Sappers have an independent para field company and most of these retired and serving officers have served with this unit. Today’s demonstration showcased their mettle and professionalism. They displayed their prowess in adventure activities by jumping from a height. Some are above the age of 60,” a senior BEG officer said.

Lt Gen Yogendra Dimri, General Officer Commanding of the 21 Corps, Brigadier M J Kumar, Commandant of the BEG and 37 others accompanied Hasabnis as they jumped from an AN-32 transport aircraft of the Indian Air Force flying at a height ranging from 1,200ft to 6,000ft. The event culminated with a sky diving display by veterans Lieutenant General R R Goswami (Retd) and Brigadier S R Mazagaonkar (Retd).

“I served in the para field company from 1980 to 1983 and successfully did 100 para jumps. Post-retirement, I took lessons in sky diving in Dubai and resumed jumping in 2017. It was my 118th jump today and I feel proud about doing it before my unit,” Mazagaonkar, 70, said.

Goswami, 71, a former Engineer-in-Chief of the Corps of Engineers, said, “I have been doing sky diving from 1977. Today’s was my 202th jump. Performing before my unit was a proud moment.”

Brigadier Kumar said, “It was an apt way to pay respect to those brave soldiers, who made the supreme sacrifice on the battlefields from the European theatre to Jammu & Kashmir during pre- and post-independence period over the 200 years.”

CME Commandant Spots Big Role For Army Engineers

College of Military Engineering (CME) Commandant Lt Gen Michael Mathews, who is also the colonel commandant of the BEG, told reporters that the Corps of Engineers will play ensure mobility of forces in future wars.

"The engineers have important roles in offensive and defensive operations, including laying mines and clearing minefields. Since Artificial Intelligence and robotics will define future warfare, they are a part of our syllabus for officers and the sappers at the CME," he said.

Title: PM Modi and Godse believe in same ideology: Rahul Gandhi
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Congress leader and Wayanad MP Rahul Gandhi offers floral tributes at the portrait of Mahatma Gandhi in Kalpet... Read More

KALPETTA: Congress politician Rahul Gandhi on Thursday launched a scathing attack on PM Modi, saying Modi and Nathuram Godse , Mahatma Gandhi ’s assassin, believe in the same ideology.

At a public meeting in his Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad at the end of a ‘Save the Constitution ’ march on Martyrs’ Day, Rahul said both Modi and Godse were filled with hatred. “Nathuram Godse and Narendra Modi believe in the same ideology. There is no difference, except Narendra Modi does not have the guts to say he believes in Nathuram Godse,” he said.

“Godse shot Mahatma Gandhi because he didn’t believe in himself. He loved no one and cared for nobody, and believed in nobody. That is the same with our PM. He only loves himself, he only believes in himself and he is not interested in listening to the billions of voices of the country ,” he said.

“Today, Indians are being made to prove that they are Indians. Who is Narendra Modi to decide if I am Indian? Who has given him the licence to decide who is an Indian and who is not an Indian? There are 1.3 billion Indians who don’t have to prove that they are Indians to these people,” he said. Rahul alleged that the PM was trying to distract the country from issues like economy and jobs.

Title: Man axed to death by son
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Allahabad: A 70-year-old man was allegedly axed to death by his elder son in Lachchipur village under Raniganj police station in Pratapgarh late on Wednesday night. The accused was later arrested.

The deceased father is identified as Ram Das and the accused son is identified as Abhayraj alias Pappu.

Deputy SP (Raniganj) Atul Anjan Tripathi said, “Pappu was irked over his father’s repeated persuasion to look for a job and earn his livelihood. In a fit of rage, around 2:30 am, Pappu attacked his father’s head with an axe when he was asleep in his room. Ram Das died on the way to the hospital.”

“Slain Ramdas lived with his three sons and daughter-in-laws. Pappu, a father of three kids, was not looking for any job and had been relying on other family members,” he said.

“Pappu’s wife had left him about a month ago over the same issue,” added Tripathi.

Title: Man arrested on charge of raping 6-year-old daughter in Maharashtra
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

Title: Residents fume as GHMC winks at Alwal’s dirty lakes, damaged roads
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Kotha Cheruvu covered in water hyacinth.

HYDERABAD: Residents of Alwal circle have finally raised their voice against the dirty lakes and damaged roads in their locality.

According to the residents, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation ( GHMC ) authorities have completely ignored the area. While the road adjacent to Telangana Talli statue cries out for repair, water hyacinth has grown in Kotha Cheruvu and Chinna Rayudu Cheruvu.

“The water is hardly visible and the lakes look like vast green fields as they have not been cleaned for a long time. Mosquito menace has also increased and we fear that local residents will soon suffer from vector-borne diseases,” said Srinivas Varma , a resident of Alwal.

The residents have also filed complaints about sewage from surrounding localities flowing into the lakes.

Meanwhile, residents of Anand Rao Nagar complained about the dismal condition of roads. “The civic authorities told us that road restoration works will be taken up within in a week, but nothing has been done so far. Some roads in Alwal are still in a pathetic condition,” said Vara Kumar, a local resident.

The road connecting Telangana Talli statue with Old Alwal is dotted with potholes. While GHMC workers have filled a few of them with gravel for temporary relief to commuters, many are still in need of repair.

The sewage network in Reddy Colony has also been causing inconvenience to the residents of Old Alwal. A senior citizen lashed out at the local politicians for the poor condition of the sewage network and said, “Ahead of elections, politicians promise new drainage lines, but they fail to keep their promises and blame it on lack of funds.”

Meanwhile, GHMC officials said they are in the process of procuring floating trash collectors to clean the lakes.

Title: Memorial to illustrious soldier on BEG premises part of heritage walk
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Savee Erappa Satoor’s memorial has a deep history connected with the Bombay Sappers

PUNE: The bicentenary heritage walks to showcase the contributions of Bombay Sappers will also cover the unique memorial of Savee Erappa Satoor, a soldier who rose to prominence from a ‘boy’ to the rank of Group Subedar Major of the Bombay Sappers centre in the 19th century.

Over five decades of the inspiring military journey of the soldier has been inspiring the Boys’ Companies of the Bombay Sappers even after 137 years.

A Group Subedar Major has administrative power and the person is considered as the seniormost army person among Junior Commissioned Officers and Other Ranks. Traditionally, he deals with all issues related to both ranks.

Satoor’s sincerity at work, his dedication and soldiering spirit had helped him achieve the feat which he may not even have imagined at the time of his induction in the force. He joined the Bombay Sappers as an eight-year-old boy before being recruited as a solider in 1857.

“He participated in the battles of Bushire in Persia, Abyssinia and Central India, his bravery and leadership earning him the respect of his commanders. He rose through the ranks before finally becoming the second Group Subedar Major of the Bombay Sappers, a position he held between 1876 and 1880. He died on December 9, 1883 at Khadki at the age of 60,” the army records read.

His ‘samadhi’ exists today near the old dairy farm inside the Bombay Engineering Group (BEG) and Centre where it is maintained.

A line at the bottom of the gravestone reads, “From Recruit Boyhood to Highest Rank’, and his descendants visit the Centre to this day to pay homage at his grave.

His great grandson Narsing Satoor (90), who retired as head of Yerawada prison press, told TOI on Saturday, “It’s a proud moment for all our family that his samadhi is a part of the heritage walk . People will know about his contributions to the Bombay Sappers.”

The Satoor family originally hails from Hyderabad in Andhra Pradesh. “Savee’s father Erappa had also served in the British Army. Erappa was killed when he was deployed on guard duty at Koregaon Bhima victory pillar in 1827. Because of this, his son son Savee was inducted in the Boys’ Company of the Sappers in 1857 and subsequently he made history,” Narsing said.

The military tradition of the family continued as his great grandsons joined the Indian Navy, Maharashtra Police and Indian Army in pre and post-independence era.

“Even after 137 years, the Bombay Sappers has not forgotten his contributions. They organise military function to mark his death anniversary every year on December 9 at his grave. We feel proud whenever we visit the grave,” his great great grandson Sarang said.

A senior army officer from the centre said, “Savee Satoor has become a source of inspiration for our Boys’ Companies. They get inspired by his sincerity and bravery he displayed during his military service in the force.”

Title: Maharashtra: Leopard trapped in Kanhere village
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Forest officials said the leopard attacked domestic animals on four occasions in the past 15 days

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: A leopard , believed to have terrorized Katewadi, Kanhere and other villages in Baramati over the past fortnight, has been trapped by the forest department.

Forest department officials said the leopard attacked domestic animals on four occasions in the past 15 days. It was trapped in a cage installed in Kanhere.

Vaibhav Bhalerao, assistant conservator of forests, Pune division, confirmed to TOI that the leopard was trapped in the early hours on Thursday.

“The villagers informed us at 4am today that a leopard has been trapped in the cage, which was installed on the field of Santosh Jadhav, a farmer,” round forest officer Trimbak Jarad said.

The field is located 3-4km away from the village proper. The forest department dispatched an eight-member team to the village to recover the 10-year-old male leopard, Jarad said.

Sugar cane is cultivated on a large scale in Kanhere and its surrounding villages. “Sugar cane fields provide a good hiding place for leopards. The leopard was sighted in Kanhere, Katewadi and the surrounding villages for over the past fortnight. There have been four attacks on domestic animals in these villages. We also spotted a leopard’s pugmarks and installed a cage,” Jarad said.

A sheep was injured in a suspected leopard attack on January 20 in Katewadi, while three days later, a goat was killed and a sheep was injured in Kanhere, sparking panic among the villagers. The forest department installed the cage on January 24.

The leopard has been sent to Pune, where it would be placed under observation for two or three days. “Usually, when a leopard is trapped in a cage, it aggressive and throws itself against the cage, injuring itself. Veterinary doctors will check for any minor injuries and treat them,” Jarad said.

Title: ‘Youths have to play big role in making khadi global brand’
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Ashok Gehlot during a function at OTS on Wednesday

JAIPUR: The gennext will have to play an important role in our endeavor to make Khadi a global brand, chief minister Ashok Gehlot said while inaugurating an event on how to take iconic fabric to global markets and spread the message of simplicity and self-reliance which Mahatma Gandhi propounded.

He said khadi is a potential medium in the rural areas to provide employment to people, especially women. “This is the reason we took the decision to give 50% debate on khadi products so that the producers, weavers and workers engaged in the occupation would be benefitted. We need to ensure that the gennext finds interest in the occupation which will help us in scaling brand khadi in domestic and overseas markets,” said the chief minister. He said the state government extended the celebration of 150th anniversary of Gandhiji by one year because much of the time last year was lost to elections, leaving limited scope to spread messages of the father of the nation.

Industries minister Prasadi Lal Meena also reiterated the need to provide impetus to the sector through various means so that the gennext takes interest in the craft.

“Because of the historic 50% rebate, khadi sales that stagnated between Rs 60-80 crore in the past five years, would reach Rs 100 crore this year. Also, the chief minister in his Budget has increased the revolving fund size to Rs 10 crore from Rs 3 crore this year,” said Subodh Agarwal, additional chief secretary, Industries.

The revolving fund is used to provide incentives to the institutions engaged in the khadi industry.

The government has sanctioned Rs 2.25 crore to set up a khadi plaza in Bikaner to promote the industry. “A similar plaza is being planned to be set up in Jaipur. Besides, we are taking up various initiatives, especially for the welfare of katins, weavers and workers, for which a budget of Rs 10 crore would be set aside next year,” added Agarwal.

Entrepreneur Shailini Sheth Amin, who addressed the gathering, said that khadi at present lacks clarity in farm to silver-stage linkages.

“We cannot trace where the cotton comes from and which type of cotton it is…All fabrics should have more details on who made it, from which village, region, how many spinners, and weavers were involved in making it. In fact, many accreditation agencies and buyers have approached us to say that we do not know how good khadi production is. But due to gaps in the records, we cannot get world recognized accreditation which stops many buyers to place orders.”

Chief secretary D B Gupta, RIICO managing director Ashutosh Pednekar, Industries commissioner Muktananda Agarwal, and CII-Rajasthan chairman Anand Mishra were also present in the two-day event.

Title: Cops to form chat groups with docs to tackle violence
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Panaji: After stray incidents of violence against medical professionals, inspector general of police (IGP) Jaspal Singh issued standard operating procedure (SOP) to deal with violence against medical professionals and establishments. Police will form a WhatsApp group with medical professionals to regularly exchange incidents of violence against them.

As per the SOP, police have to take precautionary and preventive measures.

The IGP has stated in the SOP that personnel at the police station-level shall have the contact numbers and addresses of all medical professionals/medical care establishments in their jurisdiction and under the new beat system, the beat officer will have such numbers and addresses.

Police stations in-charges will form a WhatsApp group of medical professionals along with beat officers so that there can be regular exchange of information pertaining to any incident of violence.

Singh said that a Whatsapp group at the SP-level may also be considered with medical professionals/medical care establishments.

The IGP said that in case of violence, once the police gets the information, personnel will immediately reach the place and protection will be provided to the medical professionals. He added that once police reach the spot, they should first disperse the mob and bring the situation under control.

In case of death of patients, the body should not be allowed to be kept in the hospital by the agitators as they would instigate further disturbance. He added that immediate steps will be taken to shift the body to the mortuary.

Any violence at a medical care establishment will be brought to the notice of the superintendent of police immediately, the IGP said

Title: Cabbie found murdered on NH-8
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: A cab driver , who was returning home to Alwar after dropping passengers from Nagaur, was found dead on the side of a road on NH-8 on Thursday morning . Initial investigation confirmed that he had been murdered. His vehicle was missing and cops are investigating the case.

The deceased was identified as 32-year-old Raju Jatav who hailed from Nangli Ojha village in Alwar district .

“Jatav’s family was looking for him since Wednesday night as he had called them when he was returning after dropping the passengers at Nagaur and had told them that he was heading home. However he did not make it back. On Thursday morning, the locals informed us about a body lying close to the national highway,” said a police official.

The officials reached the spot but no one could identify the victim and through sources finally identified Jatav. Elaborating further, the official added, “He was strangled with a rope and we could not locate his car anywhere. We are trying to find the possible reasons for this murder and are also looking at the CCTV camera footage on the highway as well as checking his call record details to see who all he spoke with prior to his death.”

Cops are looking at various angles including loot to solve the case. They will trace the passengers who had hired the cab to see if there is a possible connection and if the murder was pre-planned.

This is the third incident in a month’s time when a cab driver has been killed. In December 2019, a taxi driver from Delhi was shot to death and his body was found in Chandwaji area in the same area. A Delhi-based gym owner was arrested for this murder.

Title: What should GHMC do to solve the issue of illegal hostels
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Secunderabad: With unauthorised hostels in several parts of the city causing inconvenience for local residents, TOI asked readers what should the GHMC do to solve the issue of illegal hostels

It's not just illegal hostels, but bachelor accommodations in residential areas are also a major cause for concern. The inmates of these hotels listen to loud music till the early hours, consume liquor and often fight on the road. This is an inconvenience for the local residents, especially women. Officials of GHMC and law and order authorities should periodically carry out checks in residential areas and ensure that all property owners are made responsible for the tenants’ behaviour.

Mohammed Zaki Habeeb

Hostels should not be allowed to function in independent buildings or residential complexes. Since the hostel management or warden exercise no control over the movements or activities of the inmates, some of them indulge in vices which are an eyesore to other residents. In fact, it allows anti-social elements to develop clandestine operations at odd hours which are distressing and disturbing. The civic authorities must order closure of all illegal hostels without delay while initiating strict action against the managements. Even owners, who have let out their residence for running hostels, should be booked under relevant laws. The state government should also mull necessary amendments in the GHMC Act to not allow any hostel in and around residential areas.

Srinivasan Ramaswamy

It would be unfair to expect that GHMC officials will be able to carry out checks in every hostel in the city to prevent nuisance. Instead, the civic officials should join hands with local corporators who can help in keeping a tab on hostels in their respective areas and ensure that they do not cause inconvenience to local residents. The corporators can engage volunteers or form vigilance groups with citizens for getting information about hostels. These volunteers can also report issues faced by the residents to the GHMC who in turn can take suitable action.

K Pradeep Kumar

Not only the private hostels of Secunderabad, but many hostels in Hyderabad also pose similar problems. To manage these issues, hostel managements should not operate such establishments in overcrowded places and should always chose areas to nearer to colleges. A library should be available near the hostels and GHMC officials should take care of the sanitation problems to promote personal hygiene and welfare.

Ghanta Snehith

Illegal hostels have become havens of anti-social activities and pose a lot of inconvenience for local residents. All hostels in the city should be registered with the local police stations and regular check by constables should be recorded. Schools and colleges that run hostels should be strict with people entering its premises and not allow non-residents to stay overnight. All hostels should display their names, owner’s contact details and police station limits prominently so that people can lodge complaints if needed.

Deepesh Surana

Title: Goa government: Soon, online travel sites can enroll only legal operators
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Implementation of the new provision in the Goa Registration of Tourist Trade Act, that makes it mandatory for online travel aggregators and hotels to register their businesses will start shortly. The tourism department is awaiting for the government to approve the rules for its implementation.

“The rules have been submitted to the government,” said tourism director Menino D’Souza.

D’Souza said all those who offer rooms must register with the tourism department. “The department will act against online travel aggregators if they enroll hotels, guesthouses, or homestays that are not registered with us,” he said, adding that it is mostly guesthouse and homestay operators who run their business online by bypassing the tourism department.

He said they will not hesitate to take suo motu action if they notice violations. D’Souza said that besides losing out on revenue, there is also an issue of security. Anti-social elements can take advantage of this.

The Goa Registration of Tourist Trade Act was amended a year ago, following complaints by industry stakeholders of increase in unregistered rooms who offer their services online.

“Not only are genuine operators affected but the government is also losing revenue,” said a hotelier.

He said it is obvious now that they are losing out on business due to unregistered operators.

“This season many complained of low occupancy which was due to fewer footfalls. Another season we are hit as our business has been usurped by illegal operators,” he said.

He pointed out that in the coastal villages, many operate without registering with the tourism department. This is more prevalent in North Goa villages of Arambol, Morjim, Ashvem and to some extent in Canacona. They can afford to offer their services at a lower rate as they do not pay any taxes, he said.

Title: Allahabad University detects five fake degrees submitted to hiring firms
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

ALLAHABAD: The authorities of Allahabad University ( AU ) have detected five fake degrees that were submitted by individuals in order to get employment in different parts of the country.

The fake degrees were detected when they were sent for verification by the hiring firms.

The university administration intends to register FIRs against individuals who submitted these fake AU degrees to bag jobs.

AU Controller of Examinations, professor Ramendra Singh said, “We detected these fake degrees while scrutinising several degrees submitted by various firms which hire our students. the degrees have to be matched with varsity records.”

“The inquiry is still on and we plan register FIRs against all five individuals in this regard,” he added.

“These fake degrees are of BA, BSc, BPEd, MA and DPhil. All of them are dated between 2005 and 2011,” the exam controller said.

This is not the first time that fake marksheets or degrees have surfaced. In the past five years, AU officials have detected hundreds of them. In 2014, the varsity had detected over 140 such fake degrees during verification, claimed officials.

Many fake AU degrees had been submitted in south India including Andhra Pradesh , to bag government jobs including those of police and public service commission.

In Allahabad, a candidate trying to get a job at a Naini-based higher education institution had submitted a fake DPhil degree which was later detected during scrutiny.

Cases of people trying to grab a job with a foreign company through fake AU degrees hade also come to the light in the past, said officials.

Title: Session and dist courts to hear co-op fraud cases
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Jaipur: In a relief to investors who have been defrauded by the credit cooperative societies, the state legal department authorised hearing of these cases will now be held in all the district and session courts of the state.

Registrar cooperatives Neeraj K Pawan said under Banning of Unregulated Deposit Act 2019, Rajasthan has become the first state in the country to give the right of hearing and disposal of such cases to district and session courts. A notification has been issued in this regard by the department of law and legal affairs. Action is being taken by SOG against multi-state credit cooperative societies like Adarsh, Sanjeevani and Navjeevan.

According to Pawan, so far, 59,000 complaints have been filed against the credit cooperative societies on the portal of the cooperative department of cheating investors of Rs 1,142 crore by these societies. Complaints are still being received, he said.

Multi-state credit cooperative societies are controlled by the registrar of cooperatives under the central government.

Title: Government backs uniform development control rules across Maharashtra
Content:
CM Uddhav Thackeray

PUNE: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi government was likely to clear the unified development control (DC) regulations for all revenue divisions, except Mumbai, officials in the urban development department said.The unified development control regulations was proposed by the previous BJP-Shiv Sena government.A senior urban development department official said the new government favoured the proposal following a recent review.The unified development control regulations will be applicable in all districts, except Mumbai, and will help avoid any leeway with the interpretation of the development control rules in a particular area. “Though the rules will broadly be the same, some parameters of the Floor Space Index (FSI) will differ from one metropolitan area to another,” the official said.The government was pushing for these rules across all municipalities and metropolitan areas as part of the ease-of-doing-business reforms and is expected to see an increase in the permissible area for construction in these regions.At present, development permissions in all municipal corporations, municipal councils, metropolitan regions, where the regional plans regarding land use are in place, have their own set of regulations. “This will change if the new unified development control regulations are approved,” the official said.Former CM Devendra Fadnavis , who had also headed the urban development department, had pushed for the proposal. The aim was to make some industrial precincts developed with these rules.Former town planner Ramchandra Gohad had called the unified development control regulations an old concept. He said the Centre had first planned it in 1975 and the state took up its implementation in 1980. Some changes were made in the state plan cleared in 1982.The official said the unified plan would help in overall development and prevent haphazard growth in the state.

Title: People of Kho Nagoriyan to get water by yr-end: PHED
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Jaipur: Despite the fact that Kho Nagoriyan is soon expected to receive piped water , it is only 40% of the population in the area that will be able to avail the facility. The remaining 60 per cent population lives in colonies not approved by JDA and for them, the wait only grows longer.
