While SPU has been granted the special pay package, the wait continues for the other risk-prone units like Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS), State Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS), State Anti-Naxal Operation squad (ANO) and the likes who too enjoyed extra pay earlier. TOI has already highlighted the plight of the units like BDDS, ATS and ANO as they have been deprived of the special pay allowance post-seventh pay commission.

In 1986, state government had issued a GR allowing special pay of 50% for officers and 30% for drivers on the pay scale for SPU. The special package remained unchanged till sixth pay commission revision.

In the latest hike, SPU will have to remain content with only 25% increase in the pay packages of the officers and 15% for drivers on their basic salaries.

It is learnt state police have written to the government seeking guidance on giving risk allowance of special units. These units had been getting 50% risk allowance until the seventh pay commission was implemented by the Maharashtra government from January 2019. It is learnt ATS did not even get arrears of around four months after their salaries were revised as per seventh pay commission in May last year.

Senior NCP leader Nutan Rewatkar, meeting the home minister Anil Deshmukh, presented a memorandum demanding that the risk allowance is sanctioned immediately for BDDS, ATS and ANO citing additional threat on their lives in routine work. She has also demanded other welfare measures, including eight hour work shift, for all police personnel.

Title: Online renewals of health cards planned
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Panaji: The directorate of the health services (DHS) has proposed to facilitate online renewal of Deen Dayal Swasthya Seva Yojna (DDSSY) cards. Currently, citizens need to visit a local registration office for both, registration as well as to renew cards.

While registration under the cashless insurance scheme can be done at any time of the year, a DDSSY card needs to be ideally renewed two months prior its lapse in September.

“So, people need to renew their DDSSY cards either in July or August,” a DHS official said.

The officer is optimistic that during the next renewal of cards which is due in July/August, people will able to renew their cards online and not required to visit a registration office. For new registrations, people will need to visit the office, he said.

A new registration of card, the official said, can be done at any time of the year as against the earlier procedure followed, when potential beneficiaries could register themselves to avail of the scheme, only during the period specified by DHS.

The registration was not open throughout.

As of now, 2.2 lakh cards have been issued. “Anyone who has resided in Goa for five years is eligible to receive benefits under DDSSY,” he said.

He said since the appointment of the new third party-administrator (TPA), the government has been able to reduce its payouts towards insurance premiums.

A few months ago, M D India Healthcare Services (TPA) Pvt Ltd was appointed TPA, while earlier another TPA was engaged.

“The government has been able to save Rs 25-30 crore annually,” he said.

Title: 199 Mayem locals get sanads for houses
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Bicholim: A total of 199 villagers from Mayem village in Bicholim taluka were distributed sanads of their houses on Thursday at the hands of speaker of Goa assembly Rajesh Patnekar and Mayem MLA Pravin Zantye.

Mayem villagers have been fighting for ownership of their houses situated in custodian of evacuee property for the last several years. Villagers had to seek permission from the landlord for any work they wanted to carry out. They were, therefore, demanding ownership right. Then-chief minister Manohar Parrikar passed a special law granting them right of ownership. After the enactment of this law, 88 villagers were distributed sanads. However, after Parrikar’s death, this process slowed down. Finally, on Thursday 199 villagers received their sanads.

Patnekar, who was the chief guest for the function, said the efforts made by Parrikar to free villagers from the slavery of Portuguese have turned fruitful. He said that 1,500 villagers will be distributed Sanads in future.

Zantye said that the BJP government will follow up on this issue so that people get ownership of their houses as early as possible.

President of Mayem Bhuvimochan Nagarik Kruti Samiti Kashinath Mayekar has demanded that the government distribute Class-I sanads and not Class-II. Sakharam Pednekar has asked the government to undertake the process of sanads through the Bicholim mamlatdar office instead of the collector’s office at Panaji.

Title: 1 infant dies in Attapadi
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Palakkad: A 11-day-old baby of a couple belonging to Muduga community died in Attapadi on Wednesday. Last year, seven tribal infant deaths were reported in Attapadi.

The baby of Subash and Sreeja of Chindakki died in a private hospital at Perinthalmanna. The hospital authorities said that the infant had kidney-related problems from birth. The infant’s kidneys had holes, said Dr R. Prabhudas, medical superintendent of Kottathara Tribal Special Hospitality in Attapadi.

The infant was admitted to the hospital on January 26 and her birth weight was 2.560kg, the hospital authorities said.tnn

Title: Playing with fire? BMC mulls diesel stns near dumps
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Garbage dump at Yaadgar-e-Shahjehani Park is one of the nine such locations where the BMC plans to open diesel... Read More

Bhopal: In an alarming development, Bhopal Municipal Corporation has initiated the process of opening several new diesel stations on land where city’s garbage is dumped. Nine such locations have been identified; interestingly small or major fires have been reported in all these garbage dumps. Logic of opening these ‘combustible petrol pumps’ on these vulnerable locations, has literally left top state government officials fuming.

By its own admission, BMC has invited proposals without attaining expert opinion from union government’s safety watchdog, Petroleum and Explosives Safety Organisation (PESO). BMC additional commissioner, Kamal Solanki, said, “We have written to PESO seeking their point of view. Nine companies have contacted us for setting up of diesel stations and diesel bowsers (a tank mounted on the chassis of a vehicle with a dispensing unit).”

Locations include Arif Nagar, Yaadgar-e-Shahjehani Park, Bairagarh, Arif Nagar, Dana Pani, Yatayat Nagar and others. Garbage burning along these dump stations is a common phenomenon. Only recently, the Adampur Chhawani dump reported a major fire that went on for days.

BMC officials claim that having more diesel dispensing stations would add to 10% saving on fuel. However, eyebrows have been raised over the rush in inviting tenders for the proposals, barely two weeks ahead of end of the term of BMC council. BMC committee looking into the diesel scam of 2016, has not yet submitted its findings to the state government.

The civic body already has a diesel dispensing station near MANIT and around 600 vehicles get fuel from the station each day. BMC station requires about one tank of 22,000 litre diesel each day, which amounts to a fuel bill of about Rs 4 crore per month.

Additional commissioner, defends the decision, saying, “The fuel station shall be located at a safe distance as prescribed by the fire department or other authorities as per The Petroleum Rules, 1976. Besides, a safety certification of the location has to be furnished. Around nine companies have initiated talks with BMC. On Thursday, some PSUs claimed they are exempt from serving performance guarantee and earnest money deposit. The matter has been referred to the finance department.”

Title: Coronavirus in Mumbai: 3 discharged from Kasturba hospital, now 2 foreign nationals admitted
Content:
Representative image

Three travellers quarantined for suspected coronavirus last week at Kasturba Hospital, Chinchpokli were discharged on Thursday after they twice tested negative for the infection.On Thursday, two more individuals with travel history from China were admitted to the hospital, taking the count of isolated patients in the city to five. Overall, 11 patients are quarantined across the state, including five from Pune and one from Nanded.The recent admissions include a 21-year-old foreign national who was in China till she arrived in the city on January 25 and began to live in Mira Road. According to civic reports, she developed symptoms three days later and was advised admission. The other traveller, also a 32-year-old foreign national, was in Beijing. She came to the city on Wednesday and developed symptoms soon after. Both were quarantined at Kasturba on Thursday.Discharged patients on Thursday included a 31-year-old woman from Nalasopara, a 36-year-old man from Kalyan and a 65-year-old British national. The UK national, a consultant engineer, had come from Hong Kong.The union health ministry said six more laboratories will start functioning on Thursday, including one at Kasturba Hospital.

Title: Brace for dazzling show of prowess at Gomti Riverfront
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Lucknow: Gomti Riverfront has been reserved for some fun and entertainment during the five-day DefExpo which will be organized in the city from February 5-9.

People will be able to enjoy band symphony by three wings of defence forces, martial arts performances and an air show by the air force in which water rescue operation by a chopper will be enacted.

Gomti Riverfront site, between Nishatganj bridge and Hanuman Setu, has been divided between the Navy and Army. The performances will take place on the Army side, next to Khatu Shyam temple.

“Performances will be held twice a day, in the morning and in afternoon. Army, Navy and Air Force bands will perform individually followed by martial arts performances. This will include ‘Gatka’ by Sikh regiment, ‘Khukri’ by Gurkha and Kumaon regiments,” said an official.

Enactment of a rescue mission by Air Force will be another major draw during the event. For this, a chopper will take off from Bakshi ka Talab.

With the chopper hovering above the “victim”, the Air Force will demonstrate how it carries out water rescue operations. Navy will also station sail boats and water scooters in main exhibition area.

Tents are also being set up where the three forces will sell merchandise and also set up a tent for recruitment, where they will provide information about life in the forces and how one can join it.

In a separate area, tanks like BMPs have been stationed for people to take selfies with. An obstacle course has been made for visitors to check their physical endurance, though officials claim that it will not be half as tough as defence personnel have to go through. A firing range has also been set up where one can test their skills using laser guns.

Title: Nashik: Novena begins at Shrine of Infant Jesus
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

NASHIK: The nine-day Novena at the city-based Shrine of Infant Jesus started on Thursday. The annual event will culminate with a grand feast on February 8, which is expected to be attended by nearly 4 lakh devotees.

“After Christmas, this is another time for celebration. This church is one-of-a-kind as it is named after Infant Jesus. We have this annual celebration to celebrate baby Jesus,” said Father Trevor Miranda, a Jesuit, who is the chaplain at the shrine.

It is completely a spiritual programme, hence, there will be no cultural activities, said Father Miranda. He added that every year, the church keeps a theme for the Mass. This year, the theme is the ‘seven sacraments of Christianity’. Masses on the first and last days will be general, and on other days, they will be based on Baptism, Eucharist, Confirmation, Reconciliation, Anointing of the sick, Marriage and Holy Orders.

Devotees from across the country have already started coming to the city. During the Novena, there will be six masses every day, while on the day of the feast, there will be 15 masses — from 6 am to 8 pm in English, Marathi, Konkani and Tamil. After the feast, on Sunday, February 9, there will be Masses from 6 am to noon, one mass per hour will be conducted in English and Marathi. There will be no evening Mass that day.

“It is all about faith. The people come to the church round the year and they pray to fulfil their wishes. This is my fifth year in the church, and I have seen many prayers being fulfilled,” Father Miranda told TOI.

Title: Plan to promote Igatpuri as tourist spot: Chhagan Bhujbal
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Chhagan Bhujbal

NASHIK: District guardian minister Chhagan Bhujbal on Thursday said there is a plan to promote the hill station of Igatpuri, located about 60 km from Nashik city, as a popular tourist destination — just like like Mahabaleshwar and Khandala.

“Efforts are being made to receive Rs 20 crore either from the district annual plan or the state town planning department,” Bhujbal said, adding that the funds are to be used to create proper infrastructure for tourists.

The state tourism department is already developing Igatpuri and Trimbakeshwar as part of the tourism circuit.

Talking to reporters, Bhujbal said he will boost all pending tourism projects in the city. “There are some projects pending for the past many years like the boat club, wellness medical hub, kalagram and sports adventure. These projects will now be completed at the earliest. For this, we are demanding additional revenue from the state government,” he said.

Bhujbal said he will discuss the pending issues with deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar during a meeting.

Commenting on air service under the Regional Connectivity Scheme (RCS) from Nashik (Ozar) airport, Bhujbal said two airlines are operational and few other private airlines are yet to start from the airport under the RCS. “We will soon approach the private airlines and convince them to start operations,” he said.

“The coalition government in Maharashtra has been formed for the interest of state. Hence, my priority is to ensure that this coalition government does not get into trouble,” he added.

Title: Home guard deployed at IAS residence found dead in CSI Towers
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Lucknow: The body of a home guard assigned duty at the residence of an IAS officer was found on the ground floor of CSI Towers in Gomtinagar on Thursday.

The 47-year-old guard, Dhirendra Kumar Mishra, worked in the eighth floor apartment of a senior IAS officer.

An empty bottle of liquor was found close to the apartment while three cigarette butts and a blood spot were found on the stairs. Inside Mishra’s room, a packet suspected to contain cannabis was found. A forensic team is inspecting the crime scene and all items.

According to police, a private security guard spotted the body in a corner near the fire exit around 8am. He rushed to his supervisor who identified the man and informed police.

They also contacted Mishra’s wife Neelu (41), who lives in Indiranagar.

Gomtinagar SHO Amit Kumar Dubey said, “The IAS officer met Dhirendra around 11.30pm and went to his room as usual. We are scanning CCTV footage in the building for clues. A postmortem examination report is awaited.”

Mishra used to stay in the apartment of the IAS officer. On weekends, when the officer would go to Noida to meet his family, Mishra would leave for his house in Indiranagar. He had last visited his house on Tuesday for a function.

Neelu, a contractual employee in UPPCL, said that Mishra had been working for the IAS officer since 2002. She claimed that the officer was very generous to Mishra and had helped their son get a job and their two daughters get an education. This, however, made the officer’s three other servants jealous.

“They wanted my husband replaced and might have killed him,” said Neelu.

She added that Mishra was a lively person and would never commit suicide.

“We talked around 7.30pm on Wednesday and there was nothing unusual about him,” she said.

Mishra’s skull and both legs were broken. He had injuries on his chest and abdomen, too.

Title: Kota student awarded with Bal Shakti Puraskar
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Jaipur: Yash Mishra, a student of Class IX in Kota , has been felicitated with Bal Shakti Puraskar 2020 by president Ram Nath Kovind in New Delhi on January 22.

Son of an engineer, Yash has won more than 400 rewards and 200 medals in various national and international competitive examinations which made him eligible for the award. He is a resident of Odisha and is currently studying in Kota in Nucleus Education coaching centre.

Among his recent achievements, Mishra won a Gold in Singapore Asian Mathematics Olympiad, secured Rank-1 in International Olympiad of Mathematics in which 24 lakh students had participated, selected for all-paid educational trip of UK and won a gold medal in N.S.W Mathematical Olympiad. He expressed pleasure after winning the award and said that he will work for the upliftment of the nation in future.

Title: Auction govt properties to recover NMC tax: Mundhe
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Nagpur: Municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe on Thursday directed NMC’s property tax department to auction government properties to recover tax dues. He issued the directives after a review meeting of the property tax department.

Currently, the central government has 314 properties and has pending property tax dues to the tune of Rs37.86 crore. Similarly, various state government offices own 146 properties and have not paid Rs19.51 crore in NMC property tax, tax department officials informed Mundhe in a power point presentation on Thursday.

The tax department also informed the civic chief about Rs290.83 crore property tax arrears from 2,57,237 property owners and Rs99.07 crore from owners of 72,309 open plots. The civic chief expressed concern over poor property tax recovery.

He also asked about measures being adopted by the tax department to recover dues from defaulting property owners, said sources. The department informed the civic chief about its initiative of auctioning private properties to recover tax dues. So far, NMC has auctioned 150 properties of which 12 sale deeds have been executed, while due to lack of response from bidders, NMC changed the ownership rights of 138 properties.

Besides this, it has also issued warrant notices to 9,745 property owners and also executed seizure notices to 2,595 property owners. Besides this, the department has also started the process to auction another 495 properties of tax defaulters.

To this, Mundhe directed the tax department to concentrate on improving property tax collection from both private and government properties owners. The municipal commissioner said the department should start initiating auction of properties of government offices too. Henceforth, the department will first issue warrant notices, followed by seizure notices, and then auction the properties of government departments if they fail to clear their outstanding property tax dues.

Title: Fight against CAA & NRC will go on, vow Medha & Aishe Ghosh
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Bhopal: JNUSU president Aishe Ghosh on Thursday joined the anti-CAA Satyagraha at Bhopal’s Iqbal Maidan and condemned the shooting of a protesting Jamia student in Delhi.

“Union minister Anurag Thakur had recently said ‘Desh ke gaddaro ko goli, maro ***** ko’, and his man did it today in Jamia,” she said. “I condemn this attack. This has only strengthened the motivation of students and JNU will not bow in any situation. There will be no change in our fight against wrong policies despite attacks by RSS,” said Ghosh.

Narmada Bachao Andolan activist Medha Patkar, Madhya Pradesh minority affairs minister Arif Aqueel, Congress MLA Arif Masood, Archbishop Leo Cornelio and some Jamia students were among the protesters at Iqban Maidan on Thursday.

“This movement should not stop till the objective is achieved. We have been fighting for justice (for Sardar Sarovar Dam evictees) for years, which has forced the government to listen to us. Likewise, the protest against CAA and NRC should continue,” said Patkar.

Ghosh alleged that Delhi Police hasn’t done anything about the violence on students at JNU. “I was attacked yet police made me the accused. This will not stop me from fighting against wrongs,” said Ghosh, alleging that there is a conspiracy to “lock down JNU”. “People will keep asking about employment, education and other basic needs even if they lock down JNU. We will keep fighting,” said Ghosh.

She demanded to know the logic behind CAA and NRC, and why the BJP-led Centre wanted Indians to prove citizenship. “We got citizenship 70 years ago. No one can ask about our integrity and citizenship,” she said.

Asked if she would contest the 2024 election, she said, “I have to complete my PhD first. Later, I will decide what I’ll do in the future.”

Title: Turtle conservation centre to come up at Morjim
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

The centre will be a wooden cottage housing a display of photographs, films and history of turtle nesting and ... Read More

PANAJI: The state forest department is going to set up a turtle conservation centre at Morjim where a turtle nesting site is already prevalent. It will feature a display of environmental films, marine life artefacts and photographs of the turtle nesting site.

The centre is conceptualised to be along the same lines as the nature interpretation centre at the Dr Salim Ali bird sanctuary at Chorao.

“We have to do some groundwork before setting up the nature interpretation centre. By the end of the year, we will be able to set it up,” said principal chief conservator of forests, Subhash Chandra.

Since consuming turtles is no longer in vogue and they have instead become pets, the centre at Morjim is also going to serve as a medium to raise further awareness about the flippered friends that people have at their homes.

With the site expected to come up at the Morjim beach, the forest department is ensuring that the centre is built without violating any CRZ norms.

“It’s a coastal zone area, so we cannot build a concrete structure, there. The centre will be built away from the inter-tidal zone. We will take appropriate permissions from the coastal zonal authority,” said additional principal chief conservator of forests and chief wildlife warden, Santosh Kumar.

Kumar said that the structure will be eco-friendly, and the forest department will begin with the works in a few months.

“It will be a wooden cottage housing a display of photographs, films being screened at regular intervals and history of turtle nesting and turtle conservation in Goa,” he said.

“We have received government approval for the same. We will soon float a tender and carry out other formalities before the monsoon.” he added.

The Morjim beach, which lies on the bank of the Chapora river, is where Goa’s modest turtle conservation effort begun in the late 1990s. During the 2018-19 season, 22 nests had been laid at Morjim and Mandrem and 1,500-odd hatchlings had been released from about 2,500 eggs.

This season’s first Olive Ridley turtle nest on Morjim beach was laid earlier this month.

Title: Add protest costs to AAP expenses: BJP
Content:
BJP general secretary Bhupender Yadav

NEW DELHI: Accusing AAP of “sponsoring” the anti-Citizenship Amendment Act protests, including the one at Shaheen Bagh, and running a “proxy campaign” through them, BJP on Thursday urged the Election Commission of India to include the expenses incurred on these demonstrations in the expenditure of AAP’s candidates.BJP general secretary Bhupender Yadav said a party delegation, comprising Union ministers Harsh Vardhan and Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, submitted a memorandum to the commission seeking appointment of an independent election expenditure observer to take appropriate actions. AAP did not respond to any allegation.BJP claimed that all “acts at such sponsored public protests” were meant to improve the electoral prospects of the AAP candidates and “harm” that of BJP’s. “The delegation has submitted evidences, including news reports and CD containing comments of AAP leaders, to the commission,” Yadav said, adding that the poll panel had assured the party of looking into the complaint.BJP also said an independent observer could keep an eye on the “rapid pace” at which these protests were spreading throughout Delhi due to “irresponsible” remarks of AAP leaders.

Title: Father of man mentioned on FB condemns act of violence
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

AGRA: Hours before brandishing a country-made pistol and opening fire at a Jamia student, the minor from Jewar, who identified himself as ‘Rambhakt’, had posted on his Facebook wall: “Chandan bhai, ye badla aap ke liye (Brother Chandan, this revenge is for you)”. Kasganj youth Chandan Gupta was shot dead during a Tiranga Yatra he was leading through a communally sensitive area in the western Uttar Pradesh town on January 26, 2018.

However, Chandan’s father Sushil Gupta told TOI that he strongly condemned this act of violence. “I condemn the act of opening fire at Jamia protesters in the strongest possible words. We are a non-violent society and protest should always be peaceful. I have lost my son to one such act of violence ,” Gupta said.

“I support the Citizenship Amendment Act, but violence is not the answer for those who are against the law. In fact, this violent act hampers the government efforts on CAA. His act is not justified on any parameter,” Chandan’s father said.

According to police, Chandan was killed in violence that began after a group obstructed another group taking out Tiranga Yatra to mark Republic Day, at Abdul Hameed Chowk in Kasganj city in 2018.

Title: Three years in a row, no team from Pakistan likely for Ajmer Urs
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

AJMER: This will be third consecutive year in which possibilities of Pakistani delegation taking part in 808 Urs of Khwaja Moinuddin Chisty are doubtful.

The intelligence wing of both Centre and state is alerted before a month of Urs, however, this time there is no such alert from Centre so far.

The IB department of state government is responsible for the stay and security of the Pakistani delegation in Ajmer. But this time there is no such schedule.

Sources said, “It is the Central government who can take decision at the last minute.”

Meanwhile, khadims are sending invitations to devotees throughout the world, including Pakistan .

“It is our duty to invite every devotee of Sufism to attend Urs here and therefore we send invitations to everyone,” said a khadim.

Title: Farmington case: Telugu techie gets 6-month jail
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Phanideep Karnati

HYDERABAD: US-based Telugu software professional Phanideep Karnati was given six-month jail term for recruiting students to fake Farmington University , set up by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), by a US court in Detroit on Wednesday. After the verdict, ICE sleuths immediately took him into custody.

Phanideep, who had studied engineering in Hyderabad before moving to the US 11 yeas ago to take up a job there, maintained that he was not aware that it was a fake university and went by the university’s website that it was genuine. He also said he believed that the university would conduct online classes.

Phanideep was arrested along with eight others last year for recruiting students to the fake university. The university was set up by the ICE to check visa frauds. While seven others were handed out sentences in January 2019, Phanideep was sentenced on Wednesday. Last year, after his arrest, he had obtained bail.

Journalist Niraj Warikoo, in his report in ‘Detroit Free Press’, mentioned what district court Judge Gershwin Drain told Phanideep. The judge said: “I'm convinced you were guilty. It's serious, but it's not all that serious. You have a very clean record, you got a family. I view you as a little less culpable.” The other seven, who were convicted last year of the crime, were given sentences up to two years.

Phanideep would have to serve the six-month jail term after which he will be deported to India by the authorities. As many as 39 students were reportedly recruited by the eight Indians to the fake university. According to reports, over 600 students had enrolled in the fake university from India and other countries. The ICE set up the university as an undercover operation to bust a fake visa fraud.

In a statement, head of ICE's investigative division, Homeland Security Investigations (HSI), for Michigan and Ohio, Vance Callender, said the sentencing of the final criminal defendant in HSI’s University of Farmington investigation made it unequivocally clear that every individual who participated in this scheme knew it was an illegal pay-to-stay scam.

According to journalist Niraj Warikoo, Phanideep pleaded for mercy. “I trusted the University of Farmington was genuine. I relied on the website and the listing by government agencies that it was legitimate. I apologize to the US government. I should have done more research to find out if the university was legitimate. I ruined my beautiful life and career. ... I beg your mercy,” he said pleading with the judge.

Title: Cold days back again, expect chill to last 3 more days
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Sun sets over Upper Lake on Thursday

Bhopal: Winter chill was back with a bang in Bhopal and other parts of the state on Thursday after the weather systems cleared up. Bhopal residents woke up to fog in the morning while a number of cities in the state witnessed a cold day. The dip in temperature is expected to continue for at least three more days.

Officials of the meteorological department, Bhopal circle, said in absence of a weather system, northerly cold winds are blowing in the state. Dry winds would lead to dip in temperatures till February 3, after which there would be another western disturbance over the state that could lead to clouding and rise in temperatures.

The day temperature in Bhopal on Thursday was recorded at 20.7 degrees Celsius, six degrees less than normal mark, while night temperature in city was recorded at 11.2 degrees Celsius, three degrees less than normal. Wind direction in the city was north-westerly and average wind speed was 20 km per hour. Visibility came down due to fog during morning hours and it was 600 metres at 7 am.

The lowest minimum temperature in the state was recorded in Betul at 6 degrees Celsius. Places that witnessed cold day in the state included Damoh, Betul, Indore, Khandwa, Khargone, Rajgarh and Ratlam.

In the forecast for Bhopal on Friday, Met officials said there would be clear sky and mainly dry weather would prevail. Day and night temperature would be respectively at 23 degrees and 10 degrees Celsius while average wind speed will be 14 kmph.

In the forecast for state, Met officials issued warning of light to moderate fog at places, including Gwalior and Chambal divisions and Tikamgarh, Bhopal and Chhatarpur districts. Weather would be dry at the rest of the places in the state.

Title: Compensate man for wrong transaction: Forum orders bank
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Kota: Consumer forum in Baran has ordered a local branch of Punjab National Bank (PNB) to repay amount of Rs 20,000 to one of its customers whose money was ‘wrongly debited’ along with a compensation of Rs 5,000 for mental harassment in addition to Rs 2,000 for legal expenses borne by him within a month.

A PNB customer, Durgaprasad Prajapati, filed a complaint with Baran consumer forum alleging that he had made three failed attempts to withdraw money with his PNB debit card at SBI ATM kiosk at Kelwada on August 7, 2019. However, the same evening he received two messages prompting him of withdrawal of Rs 10,000 in two transactions, he alleged. The customer lodged a complaint in this connection through PNB helpline the next day on August 8, 2019 and obtained a bank statement from the local branch that stated that amount of Rs 20,000 in two transactions of Rs 10,000 each was withdrawn from SBI ATM kiosk at Thurana village in Haryana.

The consumer forum chairman Pawan N Chandra and member Madhu Nama, following arguments from both the parties held that the officials of local PNB branch are responsible for defect in their services by not informing the matter instantly to cyber crime monitoring cell of the bank. The forum also referred to the notification of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) dated June 7, 2017, that holds the concerned bank responsible to repay the illegally withdrawn amount from bank account of any customer.

The forum also directed the bank to pay 9% interest on the total amount up to the date of payment from the date of forum’s decision if it fails to pay the amount within a month.

Title: Mercury levels set to soar in February
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Heavy rains lashed the city at the start of the year

Nagpur: The year saw a wet start with thunder showers lashing the city.

Like December last year, the discontinuity in the flow of winds brought it all to January — rains, humidity as well as cold.

On the second day of the month, the city received around 20 millimetres less rain than it did in the entire month of June last year. Much to the citizens’ surprise, several parts of the city were hit by hail.

Rainfall led to increase in mercury levels and during the first week of the month, the minimum temperatures were mostly recorded above 15 degrees Celsius. From January 7, the weather again turned cold with the minimum temperature dipping to 7.9 degrees Celsius which was four degrees below normal.

January 12 turned out to be one of the coldest days of the month, with the minimum mercury levels dropping to 5.7 degrees Celsius. This temperature was 7 degrees below normal. The maximum temperature recorded on the same day was 25.4 degrees Celsius.

After remaining below 10 degrees Celsius for the next three days, the minimum temperatures again saw a rise halfway through the month.

On January 30, the city’s maximum temperature saw a significant rise to 30.4 degrees Celsius and remained on the higher side till the end of the month.

According to the forecast of Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC), Nagpur, the sky is expected to be cloudy in the beginning of February. Weather is expected to get hotter with a rise in maximum temperatures. Minimum mercury levels are also expected to soar in the coming week.

Between February 4-5, rain and thunder showers are expected to occur at isolated places in Vidarbha, Madhya Pradesh and Chattisgarh.

Title: Odisha advises home isolation for two men who visited China recently
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The state has advised ‘home isolation’ for two men who arrived here on a flight from Malaysia on Wednesday evening as a precautionary measure against the spread of novel coronavirus (n-CoV). Health officials said both had recently travelled to China.

The health department has kept the identities of the men confidential.

“The two have no symptoms of any illness. They, however, have declared that they had been to China recently. Hence, they have been advised to stay in isolation in their homes,” health secretary Nikunja Bihari Dhal said.

Dhal said the government would monitor their health for the following 15 days. “Our teams will check on them daily. If they develop symptoms, their blood samples will be taken,” he added.

The director of public health (DPH), Ajit Kumar Mohanty, said persons advised home isolation should not share a bed and utensils with others in the family. “There is no cause for panic. Good personal hygiene remains the most important strategy to prevent the possible spread of n-CoV,” he said.

As per an advisory of the Union health ministry, those who have travelled to China recently (in January) are to be monitored and their blood samples tested in case they develop any symptoms such as a runny nose, high fever and cough. Blood samples of those who have travelled to Wuhan in the past month has to be tested even if they show no symptoms.

All samples in the state will be collected by the Regional Medical Research Centre, an institution that functions under the Indian Council of Medical Research, and sent to the National Institute of Virology, Pune, for testing.

Title: Thane: Rehabilitation of 2,000 slum dwellers to clear way for Kalwa-Airoli railway
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

THANE: Implementation of the elevated Kalwa-Airoli railway link project is likely to get a push as a major hurdle of rehabilitation of over 2,000 slum dwellers along the route has been resolved.

Urban development minister Eknath Shinde announced on Thursday that residents of 2,086 hutments right in the path of the elevated route will now be relocated in MMRDA rental housing schemes in the district.

“I have directed MMRDA to explore if the residents can be given permanent housing in their scheme. This will pave the way for easy execution of the project,” said Shinde.

It may be recalled that rehabilitation of the residents reportedly delayed the project for a few years, said an official from MRVC, which is executing the project. “We had to clear the space under the piers before we could proceed with the works. The project could now proceed,” said an official.

The 3.4km-long Kalwa-Airoli link is elevated between the main line and TransHarbour route. The project was approved in 2016 to ease congestion at Thane and link Kalyan-Dombivali and Navi Mumbai.

Title: Second electric crematorium to open in March
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Lucknow: The long-pending second electric crematorium of the city is set to start functioning from March.

Located at Gulala Ghat, LMC has spent around Rs 3 crore on the electric crematorium.

At present, the city has only one electric crematorium which is often non-functional due to its old machinery. The announcement was made by chief engineer of LMC’s rubbish removal department Ram Nagina Tripathi at the house meeting of the civic body on Thursday.

“The delay in the functioning of the second crematorium occurred due to some financial issues. However, everything has been sorted out and the crematorium at Gulala Ghat is expected to start from next month,” said Tripathi.

Title: Pune: ‘Customer care executive’ dupes woman of Rs 95,400
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: A 46-year-old employee of an IT company lost Rs 95,400 after a ‘customer care executive’ promised her a refund for a dress she purchased online.The incident occurred in July last year. The woman immediately submitted a complaint application with the cyber police station and, on Wednesday, registered an FIR with the Sahakarnagar police.According to the police, the woman had purchased the dress from an e-commerce website in July last year. Once she received the dress, the woman wanted to exchange it. She searched the internet and found a phone number, purportedly that of the e-commerce website’s customer care.“On July 5, the woman contacted the number. The call was answered by a person posing as a call centre executive,” an officer from the Sahakarnagar police said.The officer said the “customer care executive” informed the woman that the company would not exchange the dress. “However, he assured the complainant that he would refund the amount to her bank account and asked her for details,” the officer said.“The woman stated in her complaint that she initially refused to share the details of her bank account,” the officer said.“The suspect convinced the woman to share the last four digits of her bank account number and the last six digits of her debit card number,” the officer said. “Then, to divert her attention, he told her to add both the numbers and give him the total. The woman did as asked, and shared the total. The crook assured the woman that the details would not be misused,” the officer said.The “customer care executive” then disconnected the call. Some time later, the woman started getting SMS alerts of money being debited from her bank account.“In all. Rs 94,500 was debited from her account over eight transactions,” the officer said.The woman the immediately blocked her debit card and approached the police.“Fraudsters can easily access the bank account with the last four digits, as the initial digits of all the account holders are the same. People should not disclose their personal financial details, like bank account number, debit/credit card numbers/PINs to any unknown persons,” senior inspector Jayram Paigude of the cyber police station said.

Title: Congress flays cop action against protesters
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Congress leaders submit memorandum to additional superintendent of police Gopal Swaroop Mewara in Udaipur on T... Read More

UDAIPUR: Senior Congress leaders denounced lathicharge of protesters during a rally taken out on Wednesday in Udaipur against CAA-NRC.

A delegation of the party leaders met additional SP, city Gopal Swaroop Mewara on Thursday and expressed their resentment over the way the police handled the situation.

Leaders, including former legislator Trilok Purbia, chairperson of the congress committee, Udaipur city Gopal Krishna Sharma, general secretary Pankaj Sharma claimed the anti-social elements and communal forces had pressurized the police to take such an action and lathicharged innocent public.

“The lathicharge was done at two places. One at Delhi Gate and other outside collectorate. Innocent youths were mercilessly beaten up and dragged into false cases lodged at different police stations. Residents are shocked after knowing what had happened. It is truly undemocratic and unruly which deserves severe condemnation,” Sharma said.

The party men said the protesters had well in advance sought permission for the rally and they were following the route granted to them. Some shopkeepers who were CAA supporters instigated them by indulging in verbal spat at many places when the protestors politely asked them to shut down their units. The leaders also claimed that for past two days anti-social elements had been planning through the social media and looking for a chance to breach the peace in the area and they were backed by the police through this lathicharge action. They demanded cases to be withdrawn against protesters as well as ensure peace and order restored in the area. Riaz Hussain, Firoz Ahmed Shah, K K Sharma, Nasir Khan, Ganesh Rajora, Deepak Sukhadia, Nazma Mewafarosh, Dariyav Singh Chundawat were among others present on the occasion.

Title: Notices to 40 Barkatullah University colleges for not uploading info on AISHE portal
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Barkatullah University (BU) issued show-cause notices to 40 colleges on Wednesday for not furnishing the requisite information on the All India Survey on Higher Education (AISHE) portal.

The university warned that affiliation of colleges will be cancelled, if they failed to do so in 10 days.

“This is not done. Colleges have to provide information on the AISHE portal . Else, they will lose affiliation,” Bharti said categorically. BU has 480 affiliated colleges in six districts, including Bhopal .

Department of higher education runs the AISHE portal. Union ministry of human resource development (MHRD) had initiated AISHE in 2010-11 to build a robust database and assess the correct picture of higher education in the country.

Sources said that several colleges are not uploading information on the AISHE portal because they lack the requisite infrastructure facilities.

“On giving information, their fake claims could be exposed,” said a senior official of the university asking for anonymity.

Colleges affiliated to BU conduct courses for which a large number of students enrol. However, some colleges do not have enough faculty, required as per criterion.

“In some colleges professors have left jobs long back. But on paper they remain as faculty,” added the official

Bharti has made it clear that such colleges will have to face action.

“As of now, I do not have any information about irregularities in colleges. After I get their detailed information, I will take action as per the rules,” said Bharti.

Title: Two Nigerian nationals deported for overstay
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The city police on Wednesday deported two Nigerian nationals for overstaying in the country since 2018.

A police team handed over the custody of George Osaremen Eguare (46) and Tayo Adejumo (42) to the immigration officials at the Mumbai’s Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, following which the duo boarded a flight to Kigali. From there, they will fly to Lagos in Nigeria , an official of the foreigners registration office (FRO) said.

“An inquiry has revealed that the Nigerians had come to India on a business visa and were staying in New Delhi before shifting to Pune. Their visa had expired two years ago, but they continued to stay in the country,” the official said.

The FRO had later issued an order restricting them from leaving the city and lodged them at the Kondhwa police station. They were deported to Nigeria after the completion of the legal formalities.

Title: March to Rajghat stopped in tracks, students demonstrate at barricades
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

The protesters were confronted with strong police barricading near Holy Family Hospital, where they remonstrat... Read More

NEW DELHI: The ‘ Long March ’ from Jamia Millia Islamia to Rajghat, meant to commemorate the death anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi on Thursday, came to a halt when a youth shot at the marchers with a country-made pistol, injuring one on the hand. The students , joined by local residents, then demonstrated at the police barricades near Holy Family Hospital.

Protesters rallied by the Jamia Coordination Committee (JCC) assembled at Jamia’s Gate number 7 before the start of the planned march at noon. However, with exams affecting the participation of students, the organisers went to Zakir Nagar and Batla House to mobilise people. It was, therefore, only after 1.30pm that the march began. As the procession reached the intersection of Okhla Road and MP Road, a man brandishing a gun emerged from the crowd and shot at the marchers, injuring Shadab Farooq on his left arm.

Undeterred, the protesters continued their march but were confronted with strong police barricading near Holy Family Hospital. For the next few hours, the Jamia students angrily remonstrated there alongside residents of Zakir Nagar, Batla House and other neighbourhoods. “We came here as soon as we heard about a student being shot,” said Batla House resident Tawqeer. “We demand action against the cops who stood like statues while all this was happening.”

Zoya Tasleem, a master’s student, raged, “Police attack students with teargas and lathis, but do nothing to stop gunmen on the street.” Many blamed Union minister of state for finance Anurag Thakur and BJP’s Model Town candidate Kapil Mishra for “inciting people”. Asif Ali, a law student at DU, held a placard that said: “Anurag Thakur, badhai ho tumhare gunde goli chala rahe hain (Congrats, your goons are firing at people).” Ali declared, “I think what happened today was because of the minister’s provocative statement that protesters should be shot down.”

Among the protesters was Harjeet Singh, who had been attacked at Union home minister’s Amit Shah rally in Babarpur on Sunday. The 20-year-old DU student twirled his moustache and declared, “I am against the Citizenship Amendment Act. Why should we be worried about people who chose not to live in India? We must care for our people.” He claimed he was “fighting for Bharat Mata” and was a follower of Bhagat Singh.

Around 3pm, Qari Mohammad Suleman Qasmi, imam of Jamia’s Jama Masjid, requested the protesters at the barricade to disperse. “Standing here is not correct. We will continue the protest peacefully. I am ready to give the last drop of my blood to the student,” Qasmi told the unrelenting protesters.

As it got dark, Jamia students and university officials formed human chains and used a loud-speaker to ask the protesters to leave because the situation could get dangerous and the crowd finally thinned after 7.30pm.

Title: Telangana health department begins work on adding more isolation wards in hospitals
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: The state health department has started work on setting up a 150-bed special isolation ward at the state-run Sarojini Devi Eye Hospital in the next 48 hours, anticipating return of medical students from China (if the China government allows an exit).Also, additional isolation wards will be set up at Chest Hospital to house suspected cases, which are being reported almost every day now. It was also decided that 15,000 additional N95 masks and other personal protective equipment will be procured to deal with an impending outbreak of the dreaded virus.“In three hospitals, Fever Hospital (Sir Ronald Ross Institute of Tropical and Communicable Diseases), Gandhi Hospital and Chest Hospital where 80 beds are already set up, the isolation wards should be critically reviewed and action should be taken as per the feedback given by Central team,” read a memo issued by the state health department on Thursday.The memo further instructed setting up additional isolation wards at the Chest Hospital and at the Sarojini Devi Eye Hospital as per standards to meet any eventuality. “Ensure clinical management protocol, infection prevention and control in health care facilities at all nodal hospitals. Ensure critical care facilities at Gandhi Hospital,” it further said.

Title: Soil conditioner, chemical-free hair oil to debut in Kisan Mela
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Lucknow: A soil conditioner that will help boost plant growth will be the first of its kind to be launched by Central Institute of Medicinal and Aromatic Plants ( CIMAP ) during the Kisan Mela to be held on Friday.

Two other research-based products—a cream and a hair oil—will be launched at the event.

“At present, there is no soil conditioner in India that helps in plant growth, making it healthier and more productive. The product, CIM-Mridashakti, is made up of decomposing crop residue. It makes soil nutrient-rich and retains water, which boosts plant growth,” said principal scientist Pooja Khare.

The scientific institute has also created a herbal solution for treating skin problems like psoriasis and inflammatory skin conditions with the help of a non-steroidal skin-friendly cream. The cream has been developed after a research of 10 years.

“Creams used for the treatment of psoriasis or other skin problems lead to thinning of skin, exposing it to more harmful UV rays. The PsoriaCIM cream is chemical-free, aromatic plant-based and gives the best results within two weeks,” said principal scientist NP Yadav, who led the research.

After a four-year research, the scientific institute has come up with CIMKESH—a herb-based hair oil with zero chemicals, that will help fight dandruff and other hair-related issues.

Title: Odisha tops national list of police stations with no vehicles
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Bhubaneswar: Police’s mobility is directly linked with their operational performance. Odisha, however, seems to lag behind other states in not having enough vehicles in its police stations.

The Bureau of Police Research and Developments (BPRD)’s latest data on police organisations said Odisha had the highest number of police stations without vehicles in the country as on January 1, 2019. Of the 620 police stations in the state, 37 had no vehicles. Assam came second, with 15 of its 343 police stations having no vehicles.

Though the BPRD report did not name the 37 police stations that lack vehicles, sources said they were located in remote rural areas. The report said Odisha Police had 6,030 vehicles; of them, 1,823 had been given to 583 police stations.

The state police headquarters said called the data dated and said the mobility of police had improved substantially over the years. “The BPRD report is dated. It may be over one or two years old. I think all our police stations have vehicles now. Some might be under repair or temporarily off the roads,” DGP Abhay said, adding that new vehicles were being purchased for successful implementation of the state government’s ambitious 5T and Mo Sarkar initiatives.

The BPRD data also said while all police stations had telephone/wireless/mobile phone services, not all had enough CCTV cameras. Police in several states had more than 1,000 such cameras but Odisha Police had only 865 till January 1, 2019.

The data has also brought to the fore the poor allocation of funds to police in Odisha’s annual budget. Out of the Rs 1,06,911-crore state budget in 2017-18, only Rs 3,286.49 crore or 3.07% was earmarked for police. The percentage dropped in 2018-19; of the Rs 1,20,028-crore budget for that fiscal, the government allocated only Rs 3,559.51 crore (2.96%) to police.

Title: Thousands form human chain to oppose CAA
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Chennai: In a massive and peaceful show of solidarity, thousands of people including students from a few city colleges joined a human chain protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) and National Population Register ( NPR ) on January 30 (Thursday), Mahatma Gandhi’s death anniversary.

The human chain, organised by several groups under Tamil Makkal Otrumai Medai, stretched from Tiruvottiyur to Tambaram.

The protest that lasted about an hour slowed down traffic at Thousand Lights, Gemini flyover, DMS, Nandanam, Saidapet and Pallavaram. Women and children took part in large numbers, raising slogans against CAA , NRC, bearing the tricolour. Police said about 3,300 people stood from Periyar Statue in Teynampet to Gemini flyover.

The protesters were joined by various political leaders at different points along the 30-km stretch on Anna Salai and GST Road. They slammed the Centre for forcing CAA, NRC and NPR on the citizens and called it out for discriminating against one particular religion.

Dubbing it a murder of the Constitution the protesters said the CAA and NRC were aimed at dividing people along the lines of religion. “We are here to condemn passage of the Bill that became an Act, as a piece of legislation that was forced upon the country without debate and consensus,” said Mumtaz, a protester from Nungambakkam.

They called out to people travelling by MTC buses to join them in the protest and distributed pamphlets about the controversial Act.

Manithaneya Makkal Katchi founder M H Jawahirullah, who participated in the protest, said it was organised on the day of Gandhi’s martydom as the CAA, NPR and NRC are diametrically opposite to his ideals. “Gandhiji wanted an inclusive India. The CAA, NRC and NPR are divisive and discriminate people on the basis of religion. NPR has the potential of snatching citizenship of the poor and downtrodden people. Moreover, it exposes the private information of individuals.”

Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) president K S Alagiri, VCK chief Thol Thirumavalavan, CPM state secretary K Balakrishnan, VCK deputy general secretary Vanni Arasu, MPs Nawaz Gani and Su Venkatesan, and many district secretaries of the DMK joined the human chain at various positions starting from Wallajah Road-Anna Salai junction to Tambaram bus terminus.

Title: Maharashtra: Euro bank team visits Metro sites before inking loan deal
Content:
EIB officials reviewed the Metro work in Pune on Thursday

PUNE: The Metro rail project is set to receive a crucial funds injection on Friday, when the European Investment Bank (EIB) signs a loan agreement in Mumbai.EIB officials visited the sites of Metro and depot work on Thursday. The EIB is expected to extend a total loan of 600 million euros, or Rs4,705 crore, for the Rs11,420-crore project. Friday’s agreement will see 200 million euros — Rs1,568 crore — being disbursed.Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited ( MahaMetro ) officials said that the loan will help speed up the execution of the project by ensuring a consistent flow of funds. “The money will be utilized primarily for the underground tunnelling work, the construction of the Metro viaduct from Civil Court to Ramwadi (Reach 3) and two depots coming up at Vanaz and College of Agriculture,” an official said.“The EIB team sought details on relief and rehabilitation for the project-displaced and about compensation against land acquisition. They also enquired about the provisions for women and the physically challenged in Metro coaches,” an official said.MahaMetro officials made a detailed presentation, stating, among other things, that 37% of the civil work on both routes has been completed over the past 30 months.The MahaMetro official also provided an update on the land acquisition. “We are now in possession of over 90% of the land, acquired through direct purchase. The compensation has been given as per the relief and rehabilitation policy of the state government. MahaMetro is also making efforts to ensure minimal damage to environment — about 1,400 tress have been transplanted at a high survival rate, and 14,000 new trees have been planted at different locations,” the official claimed.MahaMetro is developing two Metro corridors in Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad. The first line connects Pimpri and Swargate. It will be elevated for the 11km stretch between Pimpri and Range Hills. For the next 5km, it will be underground.The other corridor, between Vanaz and Ramwadi, will be completely elevated.

Title: Delhi flight delayed by 2 hours as low visibility diverts plane carrying pilots
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Kolkata: Freak weather on Thursday morning led to the diversion of a flight , the domino effect of which delayed another flight’s departure for nearly two hours.

All 125 passengers booked on IndiGo flight 6E 854 to Delhi boarded the aircraft by 8.25am, well in time for the 8.40am departure, when the head stewardess announced the delay. The reason: the pilots scheduled to operate the flight had not arrived yet.

The announcement left passengers flummoxed. Jadavpur University faculty of engineering and technology dean Sadhan Ghosh, who was travelling to Delhi to join TERI World Summit on Sustainable Development, was shocked. “How can the pilots not be there when all the passengers are seated in the plane? This is extremely unprofessional,” he said, apprehensive of missing a crucial meeting slated for 1pm and a lecture 2.30pm.

Little did Ghosh and other passengers know that the cockpit crew of the flight were seated in the cockpit of another plane mid-air. The crew was piloting a flight from Bengaluru to Kolkata and were to switch to the cockpit of flight 6E 854 to Delhi after landing, but bad weather over the city forced a change in plans. With visibility less than 500m due to fog-like condition, the flight was diverted to Bhubaneswar. “Between 8am and 9am, visibility dropped drastically. This forced the diversion of the fight,” an official at the Kolkata air traffic control said.

According to the meteorological department at the airport, visibility was 1,500m at 6am but decreased gradually to 700m at 7.30am. Half-an-hour later, it dipped to 500m and stayed at the level till 9am. Thereafter, it gradually improved again.

An IndiGo official said the drop in visibility forced the diversion of the flight from Bengaluru. “Even as the flight from Bengaluru was diverted, passengers had already begun boarding the Delhi-bound flight. The pilots had to fly to Bhubaneswar, refuel and then return. This caused the delay. As asking the passengers to disembark would have complicated matters as fresh boarding cards would have had to be issued and flyers would have had to undergo security check again, they were asked to wait in the aircraft and served refreshments,” the official said.

The flight finally took off at 10.46am, two hours behind schedule and reached Delhi at 1.19pm. Ghosh, who missed out on his engagements in Delhi, wrote a complaint to the Directorate General of Civil Aviation, questioning why the delay was not communicated in advance and why passengers, including kids, were made to wait in the plane for over two hours.

Title: 96-year-old freedom fighter fasts at Panvel
Content:
Freedom fighter G G Parikh sat on a day-long hunger strike at Panvel on Thursday

NAVI MUMBAI: To mark the death anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi , freedom fighter G G Parikh sat on a day-long hunger strike at Yusuf Meherally Centre, Panvel , on Thursday.The ‘Fasting for the Nation’ event held at ‘Baa’ (Kasturba) and ‘Bapu’ (Gandhi) cottages saw participation of 50 others. Parikh fasted against “divisions in the country and global warming”.The Tardeo-based Parikh is head of Yusuf Meherally Centre, Panvel. He was jailed for taking part in the freedom movement alongside Mahatma Gandhi and spent 18 months in jail during Emergency. He observes a fast every January 30 to mark Gandhi’s death anniversary in Mumbai.

Title: ‘CM Naveen Patnaik has a proactive approach to public health challenges’
Content:
CM Naveen Patnaik

Is the state prepared to deal with possible cases of coronavirus?

What about bird flu?

The state health scheme

Yojana (BSKY) was supposed to be merged with the

, the Odisha State Treatment Fund and the

. But hospitals empanelled for one scheme are not entertaining the others. Why?

Any plan to merge BSKY with the Centre’s Ayushman Bharat?

The Orissa High Court had in August 2010 asked the government to start kidney transplant in three government-run medical colleges in Cuttack, Burla and Berhampur. But it’s been started in Cuttack only. What about the other two?

Why has Odisha not been able to start cadaver organ transplants?

Has your role as health minister become less significant after the health department came under 5T?

Amid bird flu and coronavirus scare, health minister Naba Kishore Das tells Ashok Pradhan about the state’s ‘proactive preparedness’ for possible public health challenges besides sharing his long-term vision for better healthcare services in the state.Chief minister Naveen Patnaik has a particularly proactive approach to natural calamities and public health challenges. Though there is no suspected case of nCoV (novel corona virus) in the state so far, we are not taking any chances. Those with a travel history to China are being kept in the ‘watch list’ and their health condition is being monitored. Two such persons have been kept in ‘home isolation’ as a precautionary measure though they don’t have any clinical symptoms. Soon test kits will be available so that blood samples can be collected by the Regional Medical Research Centre and sent to the National Institute of Virology in Pune for testing. Hospitals strategic to airports and seaports have been empowered with the required facilities to deal with any exigency.We are keeping a close watch on the possible spread of the H5N1 virus. There has been no case of a human being contracting the virus so far. According to protocol, the veterinary officials have been culling birds in some areas of Bhubaneswar where some samples had tested positive to the virus. They are collecting samples from elsewhere at random. Since H5N1 cases were reported in the state in the past few years, there is substantial community awareness. We are further building on that. There is no reason to panic.That’s not entirely true. There may be cases where hospitals have confusions regarding the merger. Beneficiaries of any one of these health schemes are automatically covered under BSKY. We will soon hold a meeting of hospital administrators to remove the misconceptions, if any.The state is open to it. I had said this earlier as well. However, we have requested the Centre to make a few changes. We want the central scheme to cover all the 70 lakh families, who are the existing beneficiaries of BSKY. The Centre’s scheme proposes to cover around 61 lakh families. This would lead to more than eight lakh families being left out of the health cover. Similarly, we have asked for free treatment, without the need for any health card in government hospitals, as the maximum patient load is on government facilities. If the Centre considers these requests, the state won’t have any problem with the merger.Starting organ transplants and offering super-speciality care for heart diseases and cancer is under the active consideration of the government, both for the VSS Institute of Medical Sciences and Research at Burla and the MKCG Medical College and Hospital in Berhampur. Super-specialty healthcare targets can’t be achieved in a small period of time. Shortage of doctors, particularly specialists and super-specialists, is a major issue. One must appreciate that the government has opened four medical colleges (Koraput, Baripada, Balangir and Balasore) in the past four years. The state had only three earlier, the last of which (Berhampur) was opened in the 1960s. Seven more medical colleges are in different stages of completion. After five more years, we will produce surplus manpower in MBBS and in various specialities. They will help offer all high-end services.The required infrastructure and protocol are in place. As and when we have a brain-dead person, and the kin are willing, the organs can be harvested and transplanted. But there can’t be a deadline for such a thing. This happens in an unforeseen situation.Not at all! This misconception seems to have been spread by my political rivals. 5T and Mo Sarkar bring any department under better supervision of the CM and additional number of senior officers. This is adding to our efforts to provide better services to our people. At the same time, ministers and officers of the department concerned are also actively involved in its workings. As health minister, for instance, I have to clear the files pertaining to health. 5T is only bringing governance in mission mode.

Title: Rs350 cr cement plant comes up in Dhar
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Wonder Cement officials at a presser in Bhopal on Thursday

Bhopal: With an investment of Rs350 crore, a new cement plant became operational in Madhya Pradesh from Thursday. Set up in Dhar district in western MP, the plant will generate 200 jobs directly. It took almost a year to make the plant operational.

Addressing a press conference here on Thursday, the director of Wonder Cement, Vivek Patni, said the company plans to achieve a combined production capacity of 13MT per annum in 2020, along with its unit at Jhajjar in Haryana. The new production units of the company came with an investment of Rs800 crore in Badnawar in Dhar district and Jhajjar, he said. The investment in the Dhar factory is around Rs350 crore.

Wonder Cement executives said that the company was earlier operating from Rajasthan and has about 14% market share in western MP.

When asked why the plant was set up in Badnawar, Patni said that the town of Dhar is the gateway of MP and the clinker (raw material for cement) for the grinding unit will be transported from Nimbahera in Rajasthan. “Now, we will be able to supply our cement in rest of MP”, he said. Nimbahera is around 250 kilometres away from Dhar.

“The new production unit also has a geographical advantage due to its proximity to the company headquarters in Rajasthan”, Patni said.

To a pointed query, Sanjay Joshi, the executive director of Wonder Cement said that though there is a slowdown in the market, the cement industry is not affected.

Managing director JC Toshniwal said, “200 people will get direct employment, while about 1,000 will get indirect employment from the new facility.”

Toshniwal said that the company will adhere to MP government’s condition of providing 70% jobs to the local people. “The 200 jobs will fall under that category,” he said.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Central health team to visit Maharashtra
Content:
Representative image

With 11 persons quarantined across Maharashtra for possible exposure to novel coronavirus , a central health ministry team is likely to visit the state to take a review of its preparedness to tackle the disease, an official said on Thursday.State health minister Rajesh Tope told reporters in Aurangabad there are no confirmed cases of virus in the state.

Title: CAA-NRC opponents too plan door-to-door, street-corner meets
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

The protests at Samvidhan Square have not wavered in intensity

Nagpur: Even as organizers appealed for door-to-door and street-corner awareness campaigns at non-Muslim homes across the city on the perils of CAA-NRC , they announced the Nagpur Shaheenbagh protest from February 3 at Teka Naka’s Farooq Nagar ground.

The announcements came during the last day of anti-CAA-NRC dharna organized by Jamiat Ulema Hind at Samvidhan Square on Thursday. A crowd of around 1,000 protesters, which had an equal number of men and women, had gathered at the venue.

Salman Ahmed, one of the coordinators for all protests taking place in city, said the dharna is ending but ‘Ethezaz’ (dissent) will continue. “Now we have to go door-to-door or hold street-corner meets to reach out to our non-Muslim brothers and sisters and tell them how CAA, NRC and NPR are not just anti-Muslims but anti-India. It is against all Indians,” he said.

Asked how the proposed campaign on the lines of Sangh Parivar’s nationwide support meet will be carried out, Ahmed said it will have to be done carefully ensuring peace is maintained.

“It has to be done with specific define and design and not just anywhere. We will have to ensure we have trustworthy friends in company. The campaign will be coordinated by non-Muslims brothers and sisters who love the concept of Indian Constitution which to promotes communal harmony and fraternity to establish peace in society,” said Ahmed.

The organizers are looking forward to collective activity with support from different organizations.

In his speech, Ahmed said the government was targeting a $5 trillion economy but was unable to contain hatred and cold war. “All our infrastructure and investments are of no use if this ongoing cold war is not contained. They are pushing the country towards a civil war,” he said.

Ahmed invoked the holy Koran to eliminate “the seeds of hatred and the poison which are now deep rooted in society. The community must know follow the commandments (Koran) of Allah and teachings of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) to achieve the bigger objective of eliminating hatred spread by evil”.

Earlier, the protesters had taken out a rally to Variety Square where they paid homage to mark the death anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.

Lawyer Akshay Samarth, in his address at Samvidhan Square, said the assassination of Gandhi was a conspiracy to divide the nation. “Those who follow the doctrine of Godse have divided the nation. They are applying the British formula of divide and rule,” he said.

Jamiat Ulema Hind Siraj Ahmed said that those in power must not think this will remain forever. “Before them, there were Pharaohs, Hitler, Mussolini who thought they would rule forever but were proved wrong,” he said.

Title: Parties backing Shaheen Bagh stir want to split nation: Amethi MP Smriti Irani
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Smriti Irani along with Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari launches the party's 'Meri Dilli, Mera Sujhav' abhiyaan i... Read More

LUCKNOW: Union textile minister and Amethi MP Smriti Irani on Thursday said the parties which lost 2019 Lok Sabha elections are trying to break the country’s unity in the garb of supporting the anti-citizenship law protest in Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh.

Irani, who was on a day’s visit to her constituency Amethi, specially targeted the Aam Adami Party and accused it of supporting Shaheen Bagh protest where anti-national slogans are being raised.

“Ek aakrosh hai poore desh mein ki AAP aur baki wo rajnaitik dal jo 2019 ka chunav nahi jeet paye desh ko todne ki baaton ka samarthan kar rahe hain. Janata ke beech mein desh virodhi naare de rahe hain (There is resentment across the country against AAP and other political outfits who lost 2019 Lok Sabha elections and are now raising slogans to divide the country),” she said

The minister added that AAP leader Manish Sisodia has already given support to Shaheen Bagh protest.

“Jo Shaheen Bagh ki aad mein apni rajniti kar rahe hain aur desh virodhi naare de rahe hain, kya unki rajniti ka sthar itna gir gaya ki ab virodhi dal desh ko baatne ki baat kar rahe hain...Jinnah wali Azadi ki baat kar hare hain (Those doing politics in the garb of Shaheen Bagh have stooped so low that they are now trying to break the country by seeking its partition like Jinnah),” she said.

Later in the day Irani addressed a public meeting during Ganga Yatra at Kalakankar in Pratapgarh where she said a true Indian will not stage a sit-in at Shaheen Bagh and speak of breaking the country. “I will pray to Ganga maiyya for better sense among people who depend on this land (India) for survival but praise others,” she said.

Title: No pact after OTS, yet OCW reaping benefits
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) continues to commit irregularities to benefit private water operator Orange City Water Private Limited (OCW). In latest moves, the civic body has started returning the penalty and disbursing amount towards the escalated cost to the OCW before executing a revised agreement with the operator.

Also, for the last 11 months OCW has been executing the ambitious 24X7 Water Supply Project without check from the third party.

In 2011, NMC had signed an agreement with OCW to execute the 24X7 project, and to operate and maintain water works. As per agreement, the NMC was supposed to ensure completion of project within five years at the cost of Rs387.86 crore and levy penalty on OCW in case of breach of conditions.

NMC had levied penalty of Rs41 crore on OCW between March 1, 2012, and March 31, 2018 on OCW for poor performance in handling water supply, failure to ensure equal water distribution in all areas, inordinate delay in completion of the project, appointment of expats (experts in water from foreign countries) etc.

The OCW failed to complete project by March 1, 2017. As a result, the cost of works executed till March 31, 2018, escalated by Rs52 crore.

Despite strong opposition and loss of over Rs374 crore, the NMC general body in March last year had approved one time settlement (OTS) scheme for OCW in which civic body agreed to release penalty, pay escalated cost, extend project deadline by 18 months and extension of five years on achievement of performance parameters from March 1, 2017 to March 1, 2022.

To execute OTS, the agreement needed to be amended or a revised agreement signed. Accordingly, the NMC water works department submitted draft of revised agreement with legal department. An official from NMC water works department told TOI that the draft is pending with legal department.

NMC sources told TOI water works department and special purpose vehicle Nagpur Environmental Services Limited (NESL) have started releasing penalty amount and escalated cost to OCW from last few months. “Very few amount of penalty and escalated cost remains to be disbursed,” sources said.

NMC water works department official confirmed that they are disbursing the money and providing all benefits of OTS to OCW. “There should be no issue as we are acting as per OTS approved by general body and draft of agreement. NMC will not incur any financial loss,” he said.

Chairman of NMC water works consultative committee Vijay Zalke agreed that providing all benefits of OTS to OCW before finalizing agreement was improper. Zalke also said that he will collect detailed information and take appropriate action.

Congress corporator Praful Gudadhe said this again proves how office-bearers and officials are working only in the interest of OCW and not for NMC and people. “OTS itself was a big scam. BJP got it approved in general body by misusing its majority. Maha Vikas Aghadi government and new municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe should conduct an inquiry, scrap OTS and save over Rs400 crore public money,” he said.

As the 24X7 project got delayed, project management consultant (PMC) DRA Consultants’s agreement for operation and maintenance of water supply lapsed on February 28 and project on March 31 last year. Still, NMC has allowed execution of project without continuation of the consultant or appointing a new one.

PMC work was to monitor work as per approved designs, check quality and approve bills. For last 11 months, NMC delegates, who are just 10 for entire city, are approving works and bills without any third party check.

OCW refused to comment stating NMC is the proper authority to speak on the issue.

UNPLUGGED LEAKAGES

* NMC and OCW signed an agreement to execute 24X7 Water Supply Project, operate and maintain water works in 2011

* NMC was supposed to ensure completion of project in five years at the cost of Rs387.86 crore and levy penalty on OCW for breach of conditions

* NMC levied penalty of Rs41 crore between March 1, 2012 and March 31, 2018 on OCW for various types of violations

* OCW failed to complete project within deadline which resulted in cost escalation of Rs52 crore till March 31, 2018

* NMC general body approved OTS to OCW by waiving off penalty, cleared escalated cost, extended project’s deadline by 18 months and achievement of performance parameters by 5 years

* NMC incurred loss of over Rs374 crore from OTS

* Civic body was supposed to extend OTS benefits to OCW after executing a revised agreement

* Draft of agreement pending with legal department for verification

* NMC disbursing penalty amount, escalated cost and also extending other benefits of OTS

* Also, project going on without consultant’s check for last 11 months

Title: Govt to conduct daily health check-up in bird flu zone
Content:
This story is from January 31, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The state government has decided to conduct daily health check-up of people residing within 3-km radius of epicentre of bird flu in the city for next 10 days. The three-day long culling operation, which started in and around the poultry farm of Odisha University of Agriculture and Technology (OUAT), came to an end on Thursday while a high-level team from the Centre visited the infected areas and took stock of the situation.

“Though there is no history of any transmission of virus from animal to human in the state, but as precautionary measure we have decided to conduct health check-up of people in the locality,” said health secretary Nikunja Bihari Dhal.

However, the rapid response teams will continue sanitation process within 10-km radius of the infected area and collect random samples of poultry birds to ensure that no strain of the virus is left in the area, an official source said. “A health team will visit households in the locality from where the virus has been detected and conduct screening of people suffering from common cold and cough.
